183501.name: Duplex
183501.description: In this word finding game the cards decide when two players have to duel for a minimum five letter word with the showing letters in it. Each duel a play wins is a victory point in the end and the player with the most victory points will win the game.

183504.name: Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Construction
183504.description:
Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Construction is the ultimate dungeon creator! By using a unique random generation system you can create endless dungeon levels using the Dungeon Construction set.

Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Construction uses multiple variations of Rooms, Corridors, Corridor Room, and Junctions to help create a randomly generated dungeon level every time.

Each of these components contains different obstacles such as doors, treasure locations, random encounters, etc... You build the level and then you explore using the second system - Dungeon Hack: Dungeon Adventure.

Dungeon Hack is a solo D&D game on a micro level using 4”x4” tile cards representing dungeon rooms, corridor rooms, corridors and junctions while colored cubes represent your characters and the ever increasing monsters. A multitude of cards depict and define the monsters, treasures, encounters, and obstacles you will face within the dungeon.

183505.name: Alpha Colony: The Galaxy Prime Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Alpha Colony
183505.description:
Build a settlement...in Galaxy Prime!

Colonial settlements have breached the infinite reaches of the universe and found their way to Galaxy Prime. Over 2 dozen of the indigenous races now vie for new territory on an unexplored world, each bringing their own unique abilities and culture to the struggle. They will have new terrain to develop and new buildings to erect, as well as new events to contend with. So whether you choose to colonize with the militant Kor or buy your way to victory with the wealth of the Thasians the fate of Galaxy Prime's Alpha Colony is in your hands!

183506.name: Ruined Fortress
183506.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 268th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features the ruined remains of a small fortress.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

183507.name: Bazaar
183507.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Product is a 30 x 32 inch, full color battlemap of a Bazaar.

The Product comes with the Square, Hex and No Overlay versions and the Virtual Tabletop Maps (VTT).

“Welcome to the Bazaar, an oasis of wealth in the middle of the desert. If your food packs are empty you have come to the right place, for the right price of course.”—Bazaar Merchant

Bazaar is a map of a medieval marketplace set in the middle of a desert.

Bazaar is intended for use in fantasy or medieval games.

The Bazaar can be used in many different ways. If the group is in the desert running out of supplies, they can spot the Bazaar to resupply.

The back tents might also have more interesting and illegal items provided by the Thieves’ Guild for the Merchant’s Guild to fence out in the desert far from the prying eyes of the law.

The group might even be hired by a rival Thieves’ Guild to grab the stolen goods in the back tent and provide proof that the Merchant’s Guild was selling contraband in their bazaar. They can then use this evidence to implicate their rival Thieves’ Guild and cast aspersions on the current Merchant’s Guild. This could end the kingdom’s permission for the desert bazaar which is giving their rivals significant profits as well. If the current Merchant Guild goes out of favor, the rival Thieves’ Guild wants to establish their own Merchant Guild allies.

This task is not as easy as one would think. The merchants might not be much a threat outside of social and economic combat, but their thief allies may be skulking about in the guise of merchants ready to protect their ill-gotten gains if the need arises. They also have a tribe of fierce desert nomads that help them avoid the worst sandstorms of the desert. Men hardened by the desert who are excellent scouts and horsemen with scimitars and bows alike. If the group is caught trying to steal the contraband, it will be a fight to leave the bazaar alive.

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
183508.description:
A Fallout thematic monopoly game.

Welcome to the world of fallout, as the Overseer has hand picked you to venture beyond the safe confines of your Vault to explore a world destroyed by nuclear war. Do you have what it takes to rebuild civilization as you buy, sell and trade your way through the Wasteland to determine the fate of mankind ? Good luck and welcome home.
183508.name: Monopoly: Fallout Collector's Edition

183509.name: Antarctic Fleet
183509.description:
From Technical Term Game Company.

This is a game based on the Victory Games Fleet System of tactical and operational naval warfare.

Individual named naval ships, airplane squadrons, and smaller coastal patrol combatants fight out a future 2nd Falklands War, Argentina vs Chile conflict, and other battles in the cold Southern seas.

183510.name: 4th Fleet
183510.description:
4th Fleet is based on the Victory Games Fleet Series system operational naval warfare featuring individual named ships, submarines, airplane squadrons, marine landing units, and smaller coastal patrol combatants.

This game covers the potential wars in The Caribbean Sea & Central America where a Nicaraguan canal has been completed.

183511.name: Destiny Aurora: Renegades
183511.description: A sci-fi, fast-paced, adventure game, that takes place both on the planet's surface and in orbit as the Renegades try to complete missions while attempting to be thwarted by the Coalition agents. Campaign-based miniatures game. Choose a ship, choose a crew and choose a side.

183512.name: Livre des Regles
183512.description:
User summary:

The core rule book ("Book of Rules") includes these major sections:

Character Creation
- Characteristics
- Competencies
- Characterization

Rules
- Resolution of Actions
- Combat
- Ranged Combat
- Character Health
- Role-playing

Magic
- Principles
- Magic Items
- Spells
- Magical Energies

Rune Magic
- Basic Runes
- Elemental Runes
- Minor Runes

Equipment
- Weapons
- Missile Weapons
- Armor
- Miscellaneous Items
- Services

183513.name: Monster Hunter Stories
videogamehonor: 2016 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
183513.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




User Summary

It’s Monster Hunter without any of the skill-based action... And you’re not a hunter. You play as a “Monster Rider”. Someone who forms bonds with the monsters of the world and fight alongside them.

183514.name: Super Distro
183514.description:
User Summary

This platformer has retro graphics and prides itself on having difficult gameplay. Your player has unlimited ammo but must avoid a multitude of shooting creatures to advance. While falling down gaps is an immediate death, each shot received lowers the health meter.

183515.description:
Promo card that was first available during the Kickstarter campaign for Vault Wars.

The card says:
Pitch Black Cavern
Blind-bid Auction:
After setting the opening bid, players will secretly select their bid amount, then simultaneously reveal them.

The payer with the highest bid is the winner. If tied, continue as a normal auction.
183515.name: Vault Wars: Pitch Black Cavern Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Vault Wars

183516.name: Vault Wars: Cursed Idol Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Vault Wars
183516.description:
Promo card that was first available during the Kickstarter campaign for Vault Wars.

The card says:
Artifact
Before storage fees: Discard 1 non-junk item and equip Cursed Idol to another player. That player may not use this ability this round.
After storage fees: Gain 1 [corruption icon]

183517.name: Vault Wars: Miser's Trove Promo Card
boardgameexpansion: Vault Wars
183517.description:
Promo card that was first available during the Kickstarter campaign for Vault Wars.

Winner cannot sell items this round.

183518.name: Secrets of the Unknown
183518.description:
From the document:

Adventure Supplement for B1 In Search of the Unknown

The true secret behind Quasquenton did not become lost with vanishing of Zelligar and Rogahn!

This adventure supplement details several encounters to bolster TSR’s B1 In Search of the Unknown.

[F]or eight characters of first to second level using the First Edition game rules.

User summary:

Free distribution via e-mail for existing customers, September 2015. Includes additional background, six encounter areas, one new spell, six new magic items, and two new monsters. Includes full-page map.

183520.name: Vault Wars: Worker Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Vault Wars
183520.description:
Adds 14 worker cards that can be hired each round from a new 'Worker Market'.

Each worker has a one-use ability that gives you a strategic advantage.

183521.description: Conquer the Star Wars galaxy in this intergalactic, hyperdrive version of the fast-trading property game, Monopoly! You can play on the Rebel or the Empire side, and your mission is to conquer planets and build bases so you can dominate the universe! When players land on your planets, they owe you rent - but the same is true when you land on theirs! Powerful Force cards will alter your destiny, but there can be only one winner. When every planet is owned, the game is over - and if the Force is with you, you'll be the ultimate winner!
183521.name: Monopoly: Star Wars

183522.name: Survival of the Fittest
183522.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for starting characters

When vicious bandits waylay a caravan bound for an outpost on the edge of civilization, the player characters are the only survivors, trapped and lost in a hostile wilderness. If they would live to see another day, they must learn to work together and discover the people they might one day become. This adventure is designed for a group of starting characters and is especially suited to new players.

183523.name: Baby Bestiary
183523.description:
Publisher Blurb:

What is the Baby Bestiary?

In a world of myth and magic, great heroes vanquish terrible monsters and earn a place in legend.

But what about the babies left behind? This book is the first exploration of a new kind of adventure, the raising of young monsters to become loyal companions, beloved friends or fearsome guardians.

If you are looking for something novel to spice up a fantasy roleplaying campaign, or simply want to see a different side to the creatures of fantasy art, the Baby Bestiary Book has all the monstrous cuteness you could want.

The Book

This beautiful, hard-cover book, the Baby Bestiary contains 80 pages of cute creatures, with full descriptions, information on caring for and raising your little monsters and tips on how to use them in your game.

183524.name: Rauf und Runter
183524.description:
Rauf und Runter is a roll-and-move board game with a meerkat theme on two layers with a few twists.

The player's meerkat pawns are magnetic and move therefore simultaneously on the top and bottom side of the gaming board.
Players start in the corners and must move their meerkat to a specific location, randomly revealed, and back to a corner. Roll the die and move accordingly one to three spaces to your destination. Borders (hedges, walls) may not be crossed. Then it's the move of the next player.

Once reaching a corner, however, the board is immediately turned upside down and play commences on this side. Players that did not reached their target space get a random one-shot-bonus of either moving two extra spaces, crossing a border, or taking a second move. The first player to visit all locations, then reach a corner wins.

Be sure not to lift your meerkat from the board while moving as this will cause the corresponding figure to fall off.

183525.name: Wellington's Victory
183525.description:
At dawn on June 18th, the torrential rain which had soaked the Belgium countryside the previous day began tapering off. Seventy thousand French troops, constituting the bulk of Napoleon’s Armee du Nord, which two days earlier had vanquished the Prussian Army of the Rhine at Ligney, now expected to exploit their initial victory by destroying the unsupported and inexperienced Anglo-Dutch forces which the Duke of Wellington had deployed across the Brussels-Charleroi highway a few miles south of the inconsequential hamlet called Waterloo.

That morning at his headquarters in Le Caillou, Napoleon discussed the impending battle with his subordinates while awaiting the arrival of several French Corps which had bivouacked further south. Disagreeing with the French generals whom Wellington had consistently defeated in Spain, Napoleon insisted that his opponent was a poor commander and that the English troops were much inferior to the French. The battle which Napoleon envisioned would resemble ‘le petit dejeuner’, Wellington’s army would be devoured as easily as a light continental breakfast.

Historically accurate game play.
7 battle maps including
- Quatre Bras
- Hougomont
- La Haye Sainte
- Plancenoit
- Waterloo
Accurate Napoleonic Units.
Five categories of unit quality.
Different types of formations.
Detailed combat analysis.
In-depth reference charts.
Advanced tactical features including:
Map zoom.
Strategic movement.
Flank attacks.
Low Ammo.
Hours of Gameplay.

Source: The Developer Website.

183526.name: Appetizing Castle
183526.description:
Аппетитный замок (Appetizing Castle) is a push-your-luck dice game, for 2-4 players who try to build the strongest castle for princess Larissa, using dice towers.

The hungry monster Kirpicheyadny ate Princess Larissa's Castle. Players help her to build a new home using dice towers, with as many as 5 dice of different sizes. Dice should be collected from largest to smallest. If building the tower failed, Kirpicheyadny begins to move, and he will want to eat the unfinished castle!

How to draw a monster from the construction? Bake cakes: even a monster makes the right choice, what to eat, when offered a cake and a brick.

183527.name: Hexal
183527.description:
From the box:

The fun game of forward thinking and awareness!

Three characteristics... colour, symbol, size.

Place your tiles such that they match other tile(s) already on the table in at least one characteristic. Simple?! Sure it is.

But be extremely cautious with what tile(s) you place. You may just be setting it all up beautifully for your opponent(s) to come in and out-think and out-score you.

Think a few steps ahead... and be aware - be very aware.

A fast paced game for 2-4 players.

183528.name: Captain Black
183528.description:
Captain Black is a cooperative board game with an electronic game master and a 3D pirate ship. The goal is to protect the pirate ship of Captain Black's ghost against all dangers and reach his treasure island in a given but unknown number of rounds.

After assembling the pirate ship from the box and provided parts, you select the difficulty and activate the figurine of Captain Black's ghost, the electronic game master.

A player round consists of rolling the die, moving up to the rolled number of spaces on the ship with his sailor, moving and activating the Captain, and solving the present or announced tasks at the location: fighting pirates, sea creatures, rats, fires, leaks or some mini games: blind snatching of items, throwing cubes, push ups/knee bends, etc. If all of these tasks are solved before night falls (i.e., the number of rounds is reached), the sailors have won; if night falls or the ship sinks or is seized by the pirates, the game is lost.

The Captain is powered by batteries and directed by plastic platforms on each ship location. The output is acoustic.

183529.name: Disney Riesen Bilder-Rallye
183529.description:
Disney Riesen Bilder-Rallye is a cooperative spin-and-move children's game with a Disney theme.

The goal is to reach Cinderella's castle before the clock strikes midnight, and the game board is a "wimmelbild", i.e., a look-and-find picture along the lines of Where's Waldo. On your turn, you spin the spinner and act accordingly:


Numbers 1-8: Move your Disney pawn 1 to 8 spaces on the road forward.
Clock: Move the hand of the clock 1 or 2 hours forward.
Mickey-Mouse: Draw and reveal the first card from the deck, turn over the sand timer, and together try to find and mark with plastic rings the depicted objects on the game board. Stop and count after the timer has run through. All may move their pawns the number of correctly marked objects.


If all reach the castle before the clock strikes midnight, the game is won.

183530.name: Catalyst (Icons)
183530.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes when a mediocre life has you bogged down, you take a trip to clear the cobwebs and look for something bigger than yourself. While traipsing through Europe, Aurthur Brunner found himself drawn to an oddities shop where he fell into items of alchemy. It wasn't long before he was almost sacrificed as part of sorcerer’s ritual! Finding out you are a latent sorcerer from a long line of them can have explosive results. The explosion took care of his captors and branded him as the alchemical menace, Catalyst!

183531.description:
This expansion comprises six new furnishing tiles which can only be played in specific locations on a player's Home board.

3 tiles which can only be played "on an underground lake":

1. Lake of the Fairies
2. Wishing Well
3. Thermal Springs

2 tiles which can only be played "on the outside river":

4. Golden Stream
5. Harvest Spirits Shrine

1 tile which can only be played "next to an underground lake":

6. Mushroom Grotto
183531.name: Caverna: Water Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Caverna: The Cave Farmers

183532.description:
Star Wars: Galaxy Rebellion is a press-your-luck dice-rolling game with a Star Wars theme.

As Han, Luke, Leia or Chewbacca, you must help the rebellion to victory. Battle across various planets up to the second Death Star.

On your turn, you roll the custom dice, try to cover at least two symbols on the current planet, and try to earn victory points and/or allies by covering full rows. Your character and many allies will help you. However if you fail to cover one or two symbols, the Sith will cost you dice. Upon completing the planet, move to the next planet until you destroy the Death Star.

Whoever now has the most victory points is declared winner.
183532.name: Star Wars: Galaxy Rebellion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast #112 - Piterpanes de 40

183533.name: Provincia Gazetteer
183533.description:
From publisher blurb:

The World of Filbar contains numerous and varied countries, kingdoms and holdings. The Provincia Gazetteer gives an overview of the land to the north that is ripe for adventurers. This untamed land is currently leaderless and under siege from a rising humanoid population. Once the holdings of a famed warlord, Provincia is now a collection of communities just trying to survive. The most notable center for population sits on the northern sea and is a trading center. Take a look at this free overview and see if right for your players!

This adventure supplement was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for beginning adventurers and a DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

183534.name: Who Are You?
183534.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here, you awaken with no identification and no memory. Beginning a desperate search, you visit curious places and meet a runaway with friends who may be able to help. But in world of strangers, who do you trust?

183535.name: Gunfire at Gettysburg
183535.description:
From publisher blurb:

You and your friends have longed to see action firsthand in what they're calling the War of Secession. But apart from your make-believe battles, you've never even laid eyes on a real rebel soldier. Until now. Now, as the world outside explodes with cannon fire and the cries of the wounded, you find yourself crouched in terror in an abandoned farm. As the clamor dies down you muster your courage to peek outside. "Please put your hands up," says a genteel Southern voice. Shaking and suddenly cold you raise your hands and turn around slowly. It is a confederate officer. Reckoning you ought to know the local terrain, he offers to take you to his commanding officer, the legendary General Robert E. Lee. He says he won't shoot you if you run, but you wonder. You're being offered the chance to play a pivotal role in history. But should you help the general whose army is overrunning your town?

183536.name: War with the Mutant Spider Ants
183536.description:
From publisher blurb:

While exploring the bayous of the Everglades, you discover a strange creature that looks like a cross between a spider and an ant. Quickly you find yourself under attack by hundreds of them. You try to escape by running down a path, only to reach a giant web with bird feathers and bones entagled in its thick, sticky strands. A clear sign for you to vamoose!" But turning back, you realize these clever spider ants have blocked you in with another web. Should you try to break through? You look around for another way out. Should you wade through the swamp? Its so murky, you can't tell what might be lurking in there.

183537.name: Mecha 1945
183537.description:
Mecha 1945 is a tactical board game where you pilot big robots in a world war II alternate history.

It is a turn-based game, programming and simultaneous resolution. Each turn you can program movement, technic and combat order and resolved them on 91 hexagons board representing Manhattan.

The game is customizable with a lot of game modes, 9 board parts, around 190 cards to build your own mecha and a website with a 3D design module. The idea is that you can assemble the arms, legs, torsos, etc. so as to design the robot that suits you the most. You will have a 3D model that you can output with a 3D printer.

Depending the game mode you have choose you have to destroy foe Mecha, stay in the center of the map, capture flag, escort VIP,...

Play with you friends in teams or against them!

183538.name: Out of the Abyss (D&D Encounters)
183538.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to a special introductory edition of the Out of the Abyss adventure, designed specifically for D&D Encounters (an official in-store play program) and the D&D Adventurers League (the official D&D organized play system).

This edition of the adventure is designed for 1st- through 4th-level characters, and is divided up into three chapters, each of which contains a number of potential adventure scenarios. Characters who finish all three parts of the adventure should reach 5th level at the end. Characters of 5th level and above cannot play in this D&D Encounters edition of the adventure, though they can play the full adventure of Out of the Abyss. Each part of the adventure should be played over multiple sessions of play. For D&D Encounters, the recommended session length is two hours. The full adventure contains additional play beyond this edition.

Playing this adventure in store as a part of D&D Encounters is fun and offers additional benefits to enhance the experience. Folios connecting characters to different factions in the world of the Forgotten Realms are provided for players, containing information and accessories, along with exclusive rewards. Dungeon Masters (DMs) receive a folio as well, themed to the storyline season (for this season, Rage of Demons). Check with your store for more details. If you received this adventure and aren’t currently associated with a store, you can find a nearby store by heading to our Store and Event Locator.

183539.name: State of Hillsfar
183539.description:
User Summary:

A free PDF produced for the D&D Adventurers League that gives additional background information on the State of Hillsfar, for D&D Expeditions games in the Rage of Demons storyline.

Topics covered comprise:

The history and current state of the region.
Localised Bonds
New Backgrounds: Cormanthor Refugee, Gate Urchin, Hillsfar Merchant, Hillsfar Smuggler, Secret Identity, Shade Fanatic, Trade Sherrif

183541.name: Patagonia War
183541.description:
Argentina and Chile almost came to blows over Patagonia at the turn of the century before war was averted. What if peace negotiations had not been achieved? Who would have won the naval contest? Now, using Avalon Hill's Victory in the Pacific (VITP), you can find out for yourself.

Avalon Hill games, though dated, are still among the most fun to play. Unfortunately, they can take a long, long time to play. Even game of VITP can take a good 4-6 hours to play to completion. Patagonia War allows players to play a game with a similar system, but in a much shorter time (5 turns, 3 sea areas, 26 ships).

VAIPA Quarterly #10, Patagonia War, contains the following items:

1. The Rulebook
2. The Map
3. Twelve Chile ship counters. Fourteen Argentina ship counters. Six Control markers (counters).
4. Small zip lock bags to place your counters into (Your option).

In addition, since this game is based on Avalon Hill’s Victory in the Pacific game, you will need a copy of that game. Specifically, you will need:

a. Damage markers
b. Disabled markers
c. Sunk markers
d. Dice
e. Rulebook

183542.name: Adventurers League Player's Guide (Rage of Demons)
183542.description:
From the title page:

Rage of Demons Edition: July 23, 2015 to March 15, 2016


From the How to Use This Guide section:

The D&D Adventurers League Player’s Guide is a comprehensive guide to all the rules used for official games. In addition to player-focused rules, it contains important information for Dungeon Masters and organizers. It contains special rules for playing Dungeons & Dragons in the official campaign.

183543.name: Adventurers League Player's Guide (Elemental Evil)
183543.description:
From the title page:

Elemental Evil Edition: March 1, 2015 to July 15, 2015


From the How to Use This Guide section:

The D&D Adventurers League Player’s Guide is a comprehensive guide to all the rules used for official games. In addition to player-focused rules, it contains important information for Dungeon Masters and organizers. It contains special rules for playing Dungeons & Dragons in the official campaign.

183544.name: Adventurers League Quickstart Guide for Players
183544.description:
User summary:

A two-page quick introduction to D&D Adventurers League play, detailing what is needed to play, how to find a game, and a very basic character creation system (refers to other sources).

Copyright notice:
© 2015 Wizards. NOT FOR RESALE. PERMISSION GRANTED TO PRINT AND PHOTOCOPY THIS DOCUMENT FOR PERSONAL USE ONLY.

183545.name: Adventurers League Player's Guide (Tyranny of Dragons)
183545.description:
From the title page:

Tyranny of Dragons Edition: August 1, 2014, to February 28, 2015


From the How to Use This Guide section:

The D&D Adventurers League Player’s Guide is a comprehensive guide to all the rules used for official games. In addition to player-focused rules, it contains important information for Dungeon Masters and organizers. It contains special rules for playing Dungeons & Dragons in the official campaign.

183546.name: AT-43 Unit Box: Storm Arachns
boardgameexpansion: AT-43: Operation Frostbite
183546.description:
This expansion includes six Storm Arachn with reaper blades miniatures for the Therian army. There are two different sculpts, five of one, one of the other, and a reference card for each. Both sculpts have the same stats.

These units were not included in any army box but do not include new rules.

183547.name: Planet X
183547.description:
Source: The Developer Website.
In a future, closer than you may think, you control a lone space traveler, who is lost on a small planet in our solar system, far away from the sun, beyond Pluto. Some people debate whether this is a planet or not...at the moment you don't care, you need to find a way to get home since your spaceship has broken down.
On Planet X, you have found numerous of ancient alien artifact teleport gates that lead to different places on the planet.
The purpose and structure behind them is lost in eternity, but somewhere on Planet X there is supposed to be a big portal leading to the space station TERRA 42, that is orbiting earth.
This is what you were sent here to find, since a strange connection to some portal here have been detected on TERRA 42.
All you have to aid you in your search is your platform generator, your space suit and your feet.
Good luck!
Planet X is a retro style 2D, side scrolling platform game where you get to place your own platforms on the fly as you play.
40 levels, all in 3 play modes, increasingly challenging, awaits you as you explore deeper and deeper into the planet.
Try to beat the levels, to beat them as fast as you can or using as few platforms as possible.
And challenge your friends to beat you on the high score lists.

183548.name: Adventurous Locations III: The Infamous Drunken Harpy
183548.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sailing over the horizon comes an oversized, purple galleon with black and purple sails. It's the Infamous Drunken Harpy! A floating brothel, casino and rumored to engage in a bit of piracy, the Drunken Harpy can sail into any port of call in your campaign.

This Adventurous Location comes complete with maps, both old school style and color, suitable for oversized printing for tabletop use and also VTT maps in both styles.

This Adventurous Location is compatible with old school (S&W/LL/OD&D) style games as well as having NPCs statted out in a style compatible with the Fifth Edition of the Classic RPG and is suitable for all level characters.

If you Like Big Boats and Cannot Lie, come see what is aboard the Infamous Drunken Harpy.

183549.description: Plastic miniatures to use in place of the large wooden pieces in the base game. Add-on during the Kickstarter campaign, but now for sale on Eagle-Gryphon website.
183549.name: Clockwork Wars: Plastic Miniatures for Unique Units

183550.description: Generals from the base game painted to replace the grey models from the base game. Add-on during the Kickstarter campaign and now for sale on the EGG website.
183550.name: Clockwork Wars: Painted Generals

183551.name: Last Run
183551.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a young international ski-racer sent to the Dolomites by your aunt to investigate the murder of your uncle. Even before you complete your first run, you find yourself involved in dangerous international intrigue. Make your choices carefully, because each determines how your story ends.

183552.name: Cyberspace Warrior
183552.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kids will be hooked by this interactive adventure as fantasy and technology collide in cyberspace. When your famous inventor uncle leaves you a futuristic video game, you enter an electronic world as dangerous as it is fun. You battle horizontal mountains, snail people, and a fierce metallic monster. But will the game eventually beat you--for good?

183553.name: Ninja Cyborg
183553.description:
From publisher blurb:

Readers are challenged to defy a part-human, part-robot Ninja who travels from the future in order to disrupt life on the dojo and steal a set of sacred scrolls.

183554.name: You Are an Alien
183554.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cosmic chaos abounds when you find that you are not an Earthling, but an alien from the planet Taiga, sent to Earth to observe. You may remain on Earth, free to make use of your ample alien powers, or set out for your home planet and the dangers that await you as an interplanetary spy. What will you do?

183555.name: Sky-Jam!
183555.description:
From publisher blurb:

Readers are part of the basketball squad on a big school team that won't accept anything less than the state championship, and can finish the story

183556.name: Égaru Idea to Market
183556.description:
Égaru Idea to Market is a card game where you can learn the concepts of intellectual property and entrepreneurship.

The goal is to create projects starting with an Idea and ending in the Market, going through the different phases of the entrepreneurship process. To do this you must lay down cards in the correct order and possibly add booster cards to your own projects or attack cards to your opponents. A project requires between 3 and 6 phases to get to market - the more phases you get in the more points you will get.

Each player can have as many projects as he wants, but if a project is not closed with the Market card, it doesn’t count in the final score.

The player with the most points when there are no more cards to play is the winner.

183558.name: Das Geisterschiff von Caerdon
183558.description:
Publisher Blurb

In dieser Softcover-Veröffentlichung erwarten den Spielleiter zwei Abenteuer, die sich jeweils einem typischen Element von Cthulhu verschrieben haben:
Zuerst gilt es in dem titelgebenden Abenteuer, einigen Meldungen von der Sichtung eines Geisterschiffs an der englischen Küste nachzugehen. Vor allem die Gespräche mit zahlreichen Ortsansässigen und die Verknüpfung und beurteilung der so erlangten Informationen treiben die Ermittlungen voran und decken mehr auf, als man erwartet hätte ...
Danach geht es in Böses Erwachen um das persönliche Grauen, mit dem die Investigatoren sehr plötzlich konfrontiert werden. In der Abgeschiedenheit eines einsamen Landhauses bricht die Hölle los – doch was davon ist real, was pure Einbildung?
Wie schon in Die Priester der Krähen werden hier zwei Abenteuer präsentiert, die ursprünglich bereits in dem seit langem vergriffenen offiziellen deutschen Cthulhu-Magazin Cthuloide Welten erschienen sind. Sie wurden für die Neuveröffentlichung auf die Regeln der Edition 7 umgeschrieben, inhaltlich subtil überarbeitet und teilweise mit neuen Handouts versehen.
Beide Abenteuer sind besonders für Neueinsteiger geeignet.
Die enthaltenen Konvertierungsregeln erlauben auch die Nutzung früherer Regeleditionen.

User description

Contains two adventures previously published in Cthuloide Welten with rules for CoC 6th and 7th Edition.

183559.name: Perplexity
183559.description:
Perplexity is a word game in which you attempt to collect letters to spell a 5-letter word. Letters are collected by landing on spaces containing a letter and answering a question. Questions are made up of some form of wordplay (double meanings, anagrams, sounds, etc).

Letters may be stolen or swapped with other players when landing on special locations on the board. All successful actions require answering a question.

The first player to collect 5 letters, spell a word with those letters, make it back to the center of the board and answer a question correctly wins the game.

183561.name: Monster High: Share or Scare Game
183561.description:
From the box cover:

Grab your ghoul-friends for a fang-tastic game of truth or dare! On your turn, spin the spinner to see your fate...Spin Share and you'll reveal your spookiest secrets, monstrous crushes, and all the stuff that makes you eerily unique...try to guess each others' answers to score! Spin Scare and beware! You'll do one of a hundred challenges so fierce and funny they'll have you in stitches! It's a spook-a-rific race to get 13 points to win the game! Monster High Share or Scare-so fun, it's scary!

boardgameintegration: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game
183562.description:
From the publisher:

Featuring beautifully detailed painted miniatures, X-Wing is a two-player game of dramatic starfighter battles set in the Star Wars universe. You and your opponent take command of Resistance X-wings and First Order TIE fighters, then battle head-to-head for the fate of the galaxy.

Secretly plot your maneuvers, fly at your enemies, take aim, and fire. It takes just minutes to learn the rules, but the nearly limitless possibilities for squad building, along with the ability to expand your fleet with other ships from the game’s expansions, ensure that you’ll find plenty of Star Wars action to explore and enjoy for years to come!

X-Wing is a two-player miniatures game of fantastic, high-speed dogfights. Now, for the first time, you can enjoy these dramatic space battles with the incredible new starfighters from The Force Awakens!

The Force Awakens Core Set is the heart of your X-Wing experience and contains everything that you and a friend need to start playing, including three painted plastic ships – one Resistance T-70 X-wing and two TIE/fo fighters.
183562.name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – The Force Awakens Core Set

boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 87 - Our Listener Top Ten List

183563.name: TXT Off
183563.description: TXT Off (Text-Off) is a standard trivia game where players move around a board answering questions about texting language, shorthand and trivia. Categories may have all players answering or just the player whose turn it is. Players earn points by correctly answering questions. First player to 20 points wins.

183564.name: The Lost Files Of Sherlock Holmes: The Case Of The Rose Tattoo
183564.description:
Holmes' brother Mycroft is caught in an explosion when his club, the Diogenes, is blown up. The player, first as Doctor Watson and then as Sherlock Holmes, investigates the explosion and discovers that it was not a gas leak but a bomb which was the cause. This leads them to investigate a case of espionage and the strange death of an unidentified man. In this game, establishing the identity of the victim is as important as finding out who killed him. The intricate plot leads the player to a great number of locations over town and involves several subplots.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lost_Files_of_Sherlock_Holmes The Lost Files of Sherlock Holmes]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

183565.name: Buzoku
183565.description:
ブゾク "Tribe" is a rather abstract cardgame rendering the conflict between two Mesoamerican tribes. The game plays over four alternatingly good and bad seasons: trying to increase the size of the tribe in each good season, and attempting to avoid the perils of the bad seasons.

It's explicitly a team game. Teams alternate play: but unlike most such card games, each team-mate plays a card secretly together, then discusses (without revealing anything about the played cards) which should take effect first. Each card played adjusts the ownership of important resources, might grant a hunting token, or might increase (in a good season) or decrease (in a bad) the size of the tribe. Largest tribe at the end of the game wins.

183566.name: The Metagame: Science Fiction Expansion
boardgameexpansion: The Metagame
183566.description:
The Metagame is a card game where you and your friends share your most profound and hilarious opinions about everything. This expansion lets you ask questions like...

Which reveals the secret meaning of the universe: The X-Files or The Jetsons?

Which is more fiction than science: Cylons or the Tardis?

The Metagame Science Fiction Expansion Pack includes 54 all-new cards that add a cosmic mix of books, films, comics, games and television to your Metagame Deck. Brought to you by the future.

Add an intergalactic dose of science fiction to The Metagame!
The Science Fiction Expansion adds 54 new cards that get you talking.
40 new culture cards: Space Invaders to Starship Troopers, Metropolis to The Matrix Trilogy, Firefly to Frankenstein.
14 far-out opinion cards, such as: "Which is more alien?" and "If you were the last living human being, you would definitely want this."

183567.name: The Metagame: Film 101 Expansion
boardgameexpansion: The Metagame
183567.description:
The Metagame is a card game where you and your friends share your most profound and hilarious opinions about everything. This expansion lets you ask questions like...

Which is more likely to incite a revolution: Thelma & Louise or The Sound of Music?

Which is responsible for the most childhood nightmares: Fantasia or Jaws?

The Metagame Film 101 Expansion Pack includes 54 all new cards that add a glamorous mix of box office blockbusters, cult classics, animated features, and silver screen treasures to your Metagame deck. Popcorn not included.

Add a dose of cinematic magic to The Metagame!
The Film 101 Expansion adds 54 cards that get you talking.
40 new culture cards: The Godfather to Grease, The Shining to The Seven Samurai, Nosferatu to Napoleon Dynamite.
14 cinematic opinion cards such as: "Which is most glamorous?" and "Best enjoyed in the dark."

183568.description:
PWNs is a unique game where you command your team of pawns to traverse a board filled with potentially-dangerous terrain to battle your way to victory.

Your team will use a combination of cards, abilities, and terrain to knock out enemy PWNs.

The object is to knock out just one team from the game. Then whichever team has the most remaining players with the most health points wins!

With so many possible combinations and variations randomly assigned at the beginning of the game, you'll never play the same game twice.
183568.name: PWNs: A Game of Strategic Mayhem
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 66: Thursday, September 15th

183569.name: OUYE
183569.description:
User Summary

The console looks like a PlayStation 4, and its controller looks like an Xbox One's and it's name is similar to the Ouya. The console is expected to sell for around $70 with one controller. The company has also allegedly spent six months working on the "unique design."

183570.name: Dimension Drive
183570.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




The universe is composed of infinite dimensions. Many millennia ago, in one of these dimensions the Ashajuls rose to power. Spaceflight granted them total domination of their galaxy. They rapidly conquered other races, turning them into slaves to further expand their war-machine.

Terror, oppression and desolation reached every corner of the universe. But the Ashajuls wanted more. The discovery of the Dimension Drive allowed them to start a war to conquer all the infinite dimensions of the universe. The Dimension Wars will last forever…

Source: The Game Website.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
183571.description:
You are a Captain of the UEF! Your RPTR class starship was on routine patrol of the Auborne system when a distress call was received. Upon warping in you quickly realized it was a trap! With the help of your crew, you must survive until a rescue fleet appears.

Deep Space D-6 is a solitaire dice game about surviving the cruel depths of space. Each turn you’ll roll Crew dice and assign them to stations. You must plan carefully to take care of internal and external threats to your ship. Survive to win.
183571.name: Deep Space D-6
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 090 - Cards of Cthulhu
1P 103 - Burgle Bros.
Potion Explosion Review
The Rebellion

Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters
183572.description:
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege is a game that utilizes WizKids Games' proprietary Dice Building Game platform in which two players take the role of warlords, collect and assemble their "party" of adventurer dice and battle in head-to-head gameplay. Each turn, players roll the dice to see what resources they have available, buy dice, send their party members into the field, and then strike at the enemy warlord. There are multiple cards available for each type of die so players get to choose which one to use. This lets players specialize dice to suit play style.

Additional cards and dice to expand your collection can be found in expansion packs. Each Foil Pack contains two cards and two dice that players can add to their Dice Masters Faerûn Under Siege collections. Players can create teams of their favorite fantasy characters from the Forgotten Realms universe.

The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters line will consist of starter sets, a Collector's Box, booster packs, play mats, and a "Party" storage box.
183572.name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege
boardgameexpansion: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege Belaphoss Promo Card
boardgameaccessory: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege – Drizzt: The Hunter Alternate Art Promo Card
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege – Playmat

183573.name: 8-bit Adventures:  The Forgotten Journey
183573.description:
User Summary

This JRPG, despite its retro look and feel, was first put out in 2013, but was re-vamped in 2015. You can play as three characters: a wizard, a warrior, and a thief who go out on a quest. The story-line is the main draw, with loot, monsters, and various vehicles. As well there is a colour-based strategy to fighting JRPG battles. The soundtrack is also from the 8-bit realm and was sold separately as well as with the game.

183574.name: Stay Tooned!
183574.description:
Stay Tooned! is a 1996 action-adventure PC game that was developed by Funnybone Interactive and published by Sierra Entertainment.

Plot

The game begins in a large apartment building in the middle of an unnamed city. The player takes the place of an ordinary patron living in an apartment. The player starts off simply channel-surfing with a TV remote and watching short cartoons and commercials that parody real-life shows (such as Seinfeld, which is parodied as Whinefeld). One channel even has the game's chief programmer providing hints on how to play the upcoming game. Several cartoon characters either forbid or encourage the player to push the red button on their remote as the player surfs the channels. When the player pushes the button, the cartoons break out of the television set, steal the remote, and cause the entire apartment complex to go into animated form. The player must recover the television remote, which is the only thing that can zap the escaped toons and send them back to TV Land, the fictional toon world found within the depths of the television. The player searches the other apartments for the remote while playing nearly thirty games contained within them and avoiding the destructive trickery committed by the escaped toons. At the end, all the toons are back in the TV, but at the last second, Chisel grabs the player into the TV. When the player lands into the Cartoon world, the player's hand will be black and white, and will scream.

Gameplay

The player navigates through twenty rooms located on five floors. The basement, attic, and several hidden rooms are also accessible. There are thirty rooms to play in, but some don't appear in all of the games you play and almost none of them appear in the same place twice in a row. These rooms all have keys to them, but you have to search for them since the toons stole them all; you can also collect random items that may be useful later.

Source: Wikipedia, "Stay Tooned! (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

183575.name: Tulpa
183575.description:
User Summary

This puzzle platformer allows you to switch between the physical Ophelia and the ethereal Oliver who can manipulate controls from a distance. Ophelia becomes stressed when separated from Oliver or when confronted by a horrible image. When her sanity snaps or she is physically hurt, both characters shatter like lightbulbs.

183576.name: Slordax: The Unknown Enemy
183576.description:
User Summary

Slordax: The Unknown Enemy is a 2D space shooter created by John Carmack in 1991.

183577.name: Invasion: Malta
183577.description:
Invasion: Malta uses many familiar game mechanics found in similar scale games. Featured here are chit draws for activation of formations and individual unit efficiency ratings. The Axis player uses amphibious landings and airdrops to bring his units into the battle while the Allied player defends with artillery bombardment from behind heavy fortifications. Special rules include heavy tanks and dummy airdrops, and more, as found in a group of random events that players draw in order to obtain special capabilities, such as Deception Measures, Gas, Anti-tank guns, Transport, Smoke Screen, and much more. As you might expect, the game includes the highest quality OoB for both sides for each scenarios; we really dug into various national archives for this game. All scenarios stop after only a few days of campaigning as it is during this time that the battle would be decided.

Our hobby has perhaps a unique ability to explore the great questions of events in history. Here, what if during WWII the Axis actually invaded Malta. Who would win? The answer turns on many additional questions and circumstances. This two-player game explores several of these in three scenarios plus the bonus game covering the historical invasion of Leros.

Fall 1940: The Italians had big talk and many objectives during the war but not enough realistic plans. Perhaps the best time for their invasion would be in the fall, and perhaps timed along with the German invasion of Britain; or, if the Germans do not invade, then perhaps in place of the actual Italian invasion of Greece. Operational plans for Malta were poor but British defenses are weak. Perhaps the Italians could catch the British not reacting in time.

Spring 1941: In April 1941 the Axis had a choice, either occupy Crete or attack Malta. On April 21st Gen. Student, chief of the paratroopers, overcame opposition from the Wehrmacht Operations Staff, and others, in Berlin and persuaded Hitler to attack Crete. But, what if Hitler accepted the alternative recommendation to attack Malta? The Germans and Italians would now have to prepare for a combined operation, air, land, and sea, and do this quickly. The forces arrayed against Malta would have been huge, but the British were far better prepared than a year before and well fortified. The bloody issue would have been in doubt from the start.

Summer 1942: After a over year of preparation and study and agreement on the need to invade, the combined German and Italian staffs had put together an extensive and complex plan for invasion. Its success depended on many factors and lessons had been learned from the battle for Crete the year before had been put into effect. All was as ready as it could be, yet they did not invade. The British were stronger in numbers and weapons but their efficiency was down due to the long siege. Was it just Hitler’s nervousness about such an unusual Axis operation, or was it the allure of bigger victories elsewhere?

November 1943, Leros: The possibility of invading Malta had passed but the British had put themselves out on a small island in the Aegean, Leros. Incredibly, a large part of the British garrison consisted of the former Malta garrison, now well rested. In effect, it was a miniature Malta. This time the Germans did not hesitate, they invaded by sea and air. This tough little infantry fight shows just what grit was involved and how the experience of fighting on Malta would have been. The British lost, but the battle was close. All the flavor of the Malta battle is here but at only one-third of the size.

TIME SCALE: 8 hours per turn
MAP SCALE: 600 yards per hex
UNIT SCALE: Battalions and companies

boardgameintegration: Wing Leader: Victories 1940-1942
Wing Leader: Victories 1940-1942
183578.description:
WING LEADER: Supremacy 1943-1945 is the second volume of GMT's exciting Wing Leader game series, which started with Wing Leader: Victories 1940-1942. WING LEADER allows you to play out large-scale aerial combats in World War II.

Based on a unique side-scrolling view, WING LEADER: Supremacy 1943-1945 lets you recreate the climactic air battles at the end of the war. Scenarios feature fights above the Reich, Normandy, Italy, Romania, the Eastern Front, and the Pacific. Players fly squadrons and flights, attempting to intercept raids or fend off marauding fighters in fast-playing games that take between 90 and 120 minutes. Rules cover late war armaments such as air-to-air rockets and jet aircraft.

WING LEADER: Supremacy 1943-1945 is a stand-alone game and features more aircraft, more squadrons, and more battles. When combined with its sister game, WING LEADER: Victories 1940-1942, this second volume creates an experience that spans the entire war.

Components:

Rule Book
Scenario Book
22 x 34" Mounted Map
700 Counters in four countersheets
48 2.5 x 3.5" Aircraft Data Cards
Two Wing Displays
Three Player Aid Cards
Two six-sided Dice
183578.name: Wing Leader: Supremacy 1943-1945
boardgameexpansion: Wing Leader: Blitz

183579.name: Hovertank 3D
183579.description:
Hovertank 3D is a vehicular combat game developed by id Software and published by Softdisk in April, 1991. It is considered a significant precursor of the first-person shooter genre, made popular by id Software's subsequent releases, Wolfenstein 3D and DOOM. It is sometimes inaccurately claimed to be the first 3D game for DOS, although it was preceded by several others which incorporated free movement within 3D environments, including Interphase, Mech Warrior, Corporation, Microsoft Flight Simulator, Elite, Alpha Waves, Starglider, and Starglider 2. The game used the same combination of scaled sprites and drawn walls that would later show up in Catacomb 3D and Wolfenstein 3D, but the walls in Hovertank 3D were in solid color, without any textures.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hovertank_3D Hovertank 3D]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

183580.name: Splittermond Einsteigerbox - Aufbruch ins Abenteuer
183580.description:
Publisher blurb (German)
Bald tausend Jahre ist es her, dass einer der drei Monde über Lorakis barst und das Reich der Drachlinge in der Katastrophe unterging. Für die Menschen, Alben, Zwerge, Gnome und Varge aber begann unter dem Splittermond ein neues Zeitalter: eines, in dem sie die Ketten ihrer früheren Sklaverei abschütteln und die Meister ihres eigenen Schicksals werden sollten.

Willkommen bei Splittermond!

Splittermond ist ein Fantasy-Rollenspiel. Eine Gruppe von Spielern schlüpft in die Rollen von Splitterträgern – vom Schicksal Auserwählte, in denen ein Teil der mythischen Macht des Splittermonds schlummert. Sie werden uralte Rätsel lösen, die Wildnis des Kontinents erforschen, Intrigen aufdecken, mystische Prophezeiungen erfüllen und sich finsteren Monstren zum Kampf stellen. Sie agieren dabei nicht gegen- sondern als Gruppe miteinander: Spielen Sie die Hauptrolle in immer neuen Geschichten voller Magie, Heldenmut, Tragik und Gefahr! Sei es als gnomischer Zauberer, tapferer Ritter, vargische Kundschafterin oder albische Klingentänzerin: Erzählen Sie Ihre eigene Legende, werden Sie zum gefeierten Abenteurer in der magischen Welt von Splittermond!

Diese Box enthält alles, was Sie zum Spielen benötigen. Neben Würfeln, vorgefertigten Splitterträgern und spannenden Abenteuern zum sofortigen Losspielen, finden Sie zahlreiche Hilfestellungen, um immer wieder neue, spannende Geschichten in der Welt von Splittermond zu erleben. Nur ihre Vorstellungskraft ist das Limit!

Box mit ca. 250 Seiten aufgeteilt in div. Softcover (im A5-Format), Karte, Markern, Charakterbögen und Würfelset

user summary (English)
This is a starter set for Splittermond, using a trimmed down version of the rules. The box contains several booklets, offering rules for the game and for character creation, several scenarios, pregenerated characters, character sheets, a map, initiative counter poster, tokens, and dice.

183581.name: Choice of the Dragon
183581.description:
User Summary

Choice of the Dragon is a text based gamebook style adventure where you play as a dragon and conquer a kingdom, fight off adventurers, and hoard gold.

183583.name: Aventurisches Bestiarium
183583.description:
This creature compendium contains creatures and beast of the continent Aventurien. It describes demons, fairies, ghost as well as ghouls, giant worms and the dinosaur-like creature "Schlinger".

The Bestiarium also contains additional rules for hunting as well as rules for fighting animals.

183584.name: Unheil über Arivor
183584.description:
"Unheil über Arivor" (~ "Shadows over Arivor") is an adventure for 3-5 players set in the city of Arivor.

Type: disaster-setting

183585.name: Abyss Raiders: Uncharted
183585.description:
User Summary

This game calls itself a Tower Defence Action Adventure game but it is really a platformer in which you go along looking for relics. At the start you do select turrets (and skills) and deploy them to stop aliens, but the main action is moving around killing aliens. The graphics are dark and lush and with the constant updating -- radar just a few weeks ago -- this game will go through many changes before it settles into a final iteration.

183586.name: Splittermond: Die Musik
183586.description:
Publisher blurb

Diese Audio-CD bietet eine musikalische Reise durch Lorakis zur Untermalung Ihrer Splittermond-Spielrunden. Sie enthält 24 Musikstücke, komponiert von Ralf Kurtsiefer, die viele Facetten der fantastischen Welt von Splittermond abbilden – von den Palästen Ultias in Dragorea über die geheimnisvollen Mondpfade bis zu den Klöstern des Aiun im fernen Takasadu.

Das achtseitige Booklet der CD enthält darüber hinaus mehrere Szenarioaufhänger aus der Feder von Thomas Römer samt der dazu passenden Stücke der CD, auf deren Basis Sie Ihre eigenen spannenden Abenteuer entwerfen können!

user summary
This CD is a musical journey through the world of Lorakis, for the Splittermond RPG. The soundtrack contains 24 tracks, composed by Ralf Kurtsiefer. The CD booklet also offers adventure seeds with suggestions for fitting tracks.

183587.name: Contact - The Score, Volume 1: Hostile Encounters
183587.description:
publisher blurb
Dieses Album liefert etwa zu gleichen Teilen atmosphärische und epische Tracks, welche den Hörer stimmungsvoll in die Spielwelt einführen. Der Stil vieler Stücke orientiert sich unüberhörbar am militärisch-futuristischen Ambiente von CONTACTs Invasions-Szenario, dem auch ein dezenter Cyberpunk-Einschlag nicht abzusprechen ist. Synthesizer und Orchester markieren dabei unmissverständlich ihr Revier. Bei manchen Tracks spielen die Themenbereiche Mystery und Horror hingegen eine nicht zu unterschätzende Rolle, so dass auch düstere Klangkreationen, die man weniger als Musik denn als atmosphärische Hintergrundbeschallung bezeichnen kann, durchaus anzutreffen sind. Den harten Stromgitarren sind hingegen die Stücke verschrieben, die ebenso harte Action untermalen sollen - im Laufe einer UFO-Invasion gibt es schließlich immer wieder mit High Tech-Waffengewalt ordentlich auf die Mütze!

Zusammen können die siebzehn Tracks dieses Albums eine spannende Geschichte ergeben, die vom Kampf der Helden der Menschheit gegen eine nicht zu bezwingende Bedrohung aus dem All erzählt. Ob die Hauptfiguren es schaffen werden, die Erde vor einer totalen Niederlage gegen die außerirdischen Feinde zu bewahren, gilt es beim Durchspielen einer Kampagne des taktischen UFO-Rollenspiels herauszufinden!

user summary
This is a soundtrack for the RPG Contact. 16 tracks composed by X-Score (Jan Haak & Konstantine Kazantzis), and one track by Ralf Kurtsiefer, provide atmospheric music for this futuristic setting.

183589.name: Horizon Chase
183589.description:
Horizon Chase is a modern take on the 90s old-school racers that we loved the most such as Out Run or Top Gear. The game features unique art direction, with a bright and colorful palette that mixes low-poly environments and highly detailed 2D backgrounds. Controls are very straightforward and comfortable, providing an exciting arcade experience. Composed by Barry Leitch (Top Gear, Lotus and Rush series), the soundtrack is uniquely techno-inspired and energetic. What really sets Horizon Chase apart from other racing games is the blend of its arcade style and the strong sense of actual exploration and discovery that the player feels through its many and quite diverse circuits, many of them dominated by natural landscapes.

Source: The Game Website.

183598.name: Uncanny Valley
183598.description:
User Summary

You play a security guard Tom who has a lot of inner demons. Wandering around Melior's sprawling compound of buildings you meet other characters as well as surprises. The controls are standard WASD and the graphics are retro 8-bit. The emphasis is on story and sub-story backgrounds, which can make the game slow or detailed depending on your interests.

183599.description:
From the publisher:

SlapCAT is a wildly fast reflex game full of slapped cats, cats in hats, dead rats, and poo. Players race to slap the parts they need, then try to build a beautiful cat while throwing fishbones and stealing from their neighbors.

Each round players build a hand of cards by slapping from a limited selection of cat parts. The players then play from this hand of cards to build a high scoring cat in front of them. But watch out -- your neighbors may attack and take your only head! What's a cat with no head?!

A mixture of reflexes, card drafting and strategic card play, SlapCAT is feisty fun that's over so fast your friends and family will be clawing at you to play again!

https://www.thegamecrafter.com/games/slapcat
183599.name: SlapCAT

183600.name: Denizens: Barbarians
183600.description:
From the publisher:

Civilization Is for the Weak

Orderly farms and towns can provide you with ale, but they also create structure that crushes the spirit, replacing righteous rage and self-reliance with ridiculous manners and clothing that'll get you killed in the real world. Come the next dark age, when dragons darken the skies, demons wander the frozen wastes, and the cities are in ruins, those fancy bards and elf princes will look to the folk they called "barbarians" to defend them. And maybe you'll help -- if they saved you the last of the ale!

GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Denizens: Barbarians is the first in a series of GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Denizens guides to the delving professions. It details the crude, angry, oversized, and surprisingly complex world of barbarians, including:


Variant templates. The basic barbarian is an all-round survivor, but the savage lands have their share of heroes who are more warriors than outdoorsmen, or vice versa -- not to mention those who wield the terrifying power of Rage.
Lenses. Play even more to type as a sea raider or a berserker, or by eschewing armor in favor of raw grit. Or play against type just to be ornery . . . not all of your kind are giants, and some are actually refined (ale is really nice) and even learn the ways of other professions.
Power-ups. Get bigger, tougher, stronger, and angrier as you adventure. Choose from a long list of options, including 20 perks, more than a dozen barbaric feats, animal companions, and the all-new power of Rage with its mighty shouts and skinchanging abilities. Show those pansy spellcasters the screaming war-face of true power!
Gear. Dine on mountain rations and rageahol, smear yourself with war paint, snatch up truly huge weapons, and lay waste to your enemies. Discover just how effective crudeness can be, and learn of storied tribal relics to quest after.
And more! Extensive customization advice, alternative wildcard skills, thoughts on getting the most from Outdoorsman, new combat maneuvers, special modifiers for your abilities... barbarians are capable above all else.


When fast-talking cityfolk, dishonorable magic-users, and cowards in shining armor make you want to snap off a stalactite and pound some enemies into the ground, GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Denizens: Barbarians is your go-to guide!

183603.name: Particle Mace
183603.description:
User Summary

A lot like the arcade game Asteroids, except that instead of guns you can only swing a mace from the back of your craft. The game is advertised as an action, adventure, strategy game, yet from the very outset it seems most akin to arcade shooters. There are 150 missions that can be made and 9 different ships to unlock.

183604.description:
Travel through the galaxy as you buy, sell and trade organizations, factions and locations as depicted in the Mass Effect video game trilogy.

Includes:

6 Collectible Tokens: N7 Helmet, Space Hamster, Normandy, Omni Tool, Shifty Looking Cow, and Mako
Custom Game Board featuring Elites, Special Interests, Mercs, and Crews
Custom Chance & Community Chest Cards
183604.name: Monopoly: Mass Effect

183605.name: Vexith Core Rulebook
183605.description:
WILL YOU BRAVE THE DEPTHS OF THE VEXITH?
Contained within these pages are the complete core rules for the Vexith Roleplaying Game, an innovative dice-based tabletop roleplaying system that allows for an extensive range of character customization and personal choice.

Flexible Point-Buy Characters
Use points to build a character from your imagination instead of being defined by a single class or experience levels. Choose from a wide assortment of advantages, disadvantages, creeds, disciplines, and professions.

Diverse Playable Species
Select your character’s species from one of 44 distinct choices, with each imparting a wholly unique gameplay experience by granting vastly different abilities. Choose from typical fantasy species like dwarves, pixies, and trolls; or play as something a little bit more exotic like a plant-based lavossi, an undead body-swapping shade, or partner with a friend to play a huge two-headed ettin.

Extensive Customization
Tailor your character by taking optional species traits, design custom weapons, research personalized spells, compose unique bardic songs, contract lycanthropy, or even rise from the grave as a bloodthirsty vampire.

Brutal Combat
Battle is exciting and chaotic, allowing for devastating critical hits, disastrous critical failures, and specific injuries that can impose long-lasting or even permanent conditions.

183607.name: Mutant Madness!
183607.description:
[Taken from the front cover text, first page text, and entry author.]

Post-Apocalyptic Hero's Mutant Powers Converted To the Hero System, Sixth Edition

What’s a post-apocalypse without a few mutants? Post-Apocalyptic Hero describes nearly a hundred sample mutant powers for Post-Apocalyptic campaigns. This Hero Plus Adventure converts them to the Sixth Edition rules.

The mutations are divided into seven categories: Offensive; Mental; Defensive; Movement; Sensory; Miscellaneous; and Disadvantageous. See below for suggestions about how characters can choose which mutations they have.

The product converts material from Post-Apocalyptic Hero to HERO System (6th Edition).

183608.name: Ninja Jamboree
183608.description:
[Taken from the front cover text, first page text, and entry author.]

Plenty Of Ninjas For Your HERO System Games

Ninjas — who doesn’t love ’em? The little scamps are everywhere from history, to novels, to comic books, to movies, to video games, just as cute as the dickens in their little black costumes... until they stick someone with a big, sharp sword or pepper him with shuriken. Since they’re so popular in so many genres, many gamers like to use them in games or as the basis for a Player Character. To help with that, Ninja Jamboree has character sheets for eleven ninja, ranging from serious “generic” ones suitable for any game to some individual or humorous ones just for fun.

The product requires a copy of the HERO System (6th Edition).

183609.name: Desafío Extremo
183609.description:
This is an educational game to think and easy mechanics, wich are based on questions and answers. We must get to the place where the challenge lies for each player who randomly received a letter of challenge.This show you the objects you will need have before departure to your challenge. But to move your figure you need energy and this energy it´s won with the correct answers to the questions of the letters

Spanish description:
Un juego al estilo del trivial (Porque es de ir respondiendo preguntas), pero más atractivo al tener que buscar cierto equipo y luego llegar a un punto del mundo según la "misión" que te tocase

183610.description:
The Chu–Han Contention is updated and commercial edition of Chuhan War, a historical wargame of Chu–Han Contention from 206 B.C. to 202 B.C.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chu–Han_Contention
The game includes three short scenarios and one long scenario. Each player plays the role of Xiang Yu, Liu Bang or Han Xin (only in 3-player scenario).
183610.name: The Chu–Han Contention

183611.name: Traveller 2e Beta Set
183611.description:
From the Introduction:

Traveller is a science fiction roleplaying game of the far future. A multitude of universes await players and you will find Traveller is capable of handling almost any kind of science fiction setting, from highly intricate cyberpunk worlds to campaigns spanning entire galaxies where mighty empires clash and suns explode.

User Summary:

Mongoose Traveller Second Edition Public Beta Rulebook. Public beta is pay-to-join. Third Imperium setting material is very brief.
Color Core rules 248 pp pdf
Printer Friendly Core Rules 248pp pdf (B&W version of core rules)
Adventure: 44p PDF of "High And Dry"
Printer Friendly Deckplans booklet: 20pp PDF.
Note on deckplans: color core rules has isomorphic color deckplan views, and the 2d view deckplans are separate. The printer friendly PDF uses instead the 2d view deckplans.

183612.description:
This small Star Wars edition of the classic Bop It! game features the franchise's beloved droid, R2-D2.

The game commands you to take certain actions (Bop it, Twist it, Pull it) in the voice of C-3PO, and you have to respond as fast as you can. If you get it right, you get another chance, but if you don't, you're out! The commands get faster the longer you go on, and you'll hear the sounds of the loyal droid R2-D2 as you play.
(description from Hasbro)
183612.name: Bop It! R2-D2

183614.name: Mythic Mortals Zero Prep Packet
183614.description:
The Packet Contains Everything you need to run a game of Mythic Mortals:

‣ Read-Aloud Rules: Includes a script that leads you and your group through setup, rules explanations, character creation, and an intro adventure.
‣ 60 Second Character Creation: Just pick your Mat, shuffle your deck, grab your dice, and jump into the action.
‣ Fast, Epic Combat: MM is laser focused on providing exciting and satisfying over-the-top action movie fights
‣ Learn to Control your Powers: Players start out with ALL of their powers from the very beginning. How will you combine them? Can you keep them under control?
‣ Bridges the Gap Between Board Games and RPGs: Tactile and Tactical, Mythic Mortals plays like a board game and tells stories like an RPG.

Includes 4 Classes:

‣ Hunter: Snipe your foes with Elemental strikes
‣ Brute: Toss enemies, smash things, yell loudly
‣ Sneak: Deal deadly strikes from anywhere
‣ Brewer: You have a bandoleer of Teas and Beers

183615.name: LeapPad
183615.description:
LeapPad is a range of tablet computers developed for children. Various models of the LeapPad have been developed since 1999. The latest of the range is the LeapPad Explorer, which was released in 2011.

Source: Wikipedia, "LeapPad", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

183616.description:
No moderator, no elimination, five-minute games.

Blink of Death is a fast game for 4-12 players in which everyone gets a role: One of the Shifter Demons, the Abandoned, the helpful Anchorite, or one of a dozen different characters, each with a special ability. In 30 seconds, The Demon must kill one others or lose.

Because Blink of Death is so fast, fun, and engaging, you'll want to play it again and again, and no two games are ever the same.
183616.name: Blink of Death

183617.name: A Night At The Movies
183617.description:
A great family game based on classic and recent movies.
Spend hours of fun as you try to recall details from your favourite movies. Your brain cells will be "Smokin'" as you try to beat the clock and your opponents, to be first with the correct answer.
The design of the gameboard allows you to answer questions both on your own turn or the turn of another player!
If you disagree with another player's answer you can dispute and provide another response.

183618.name: Mephisto (Issue 13 - May/Jun 2001)
183618.description: Issue 13 contains news, reviews, articles, and gaming material for a variety of systems. Articles also cover skirmish games (Confrontation/ Incarnation) and fantastic literature (Dune; Clark Ashton Smith)

183619.name: Mephisto (Double Issue 14/15 - Sep/Oct 2001)
183619.description:
This double issue contains gaming material for WoD games, SR, and CoC, news, articles and reviews on tabletop rpgs, TV & movies, books & comics, and video games.

The issue came with a free inlay/ booklet of 28 pages, containing a World of Darkness novella by Astrid Mosler: Die Kälte zwischen den Rädern.

183620.name: Mephisto (Issue 17 - Jan/Feb 2002)
183620.description: Issue 17 continues the tradition of the usual mix: news, reviews, articles, and a couple of scenarios and other gaming materials.

183621.name: Papair
183621.description:
Source: The Game Website.

Explore a beautiful paper island in the sky in this tiny, story-driven exploration game.

Papair is telling the story of an old pilot who lost control over his airplane as a young man and stranded on a mysterious floating island. Since then he is trying to escape from that place by building airplanes and inventing crazy flying machines.

Join him on a day when his life finally takes a turn and explore a 3D paper world in the sky.

183622.name: Seas of Iron: Battleship Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Seas of Iron
183622.description:
From the publisher:

The Battleship expansion pack contains two additional iconic ships, German Battleship Bismarck and Japanese Battleship Yamato.

183623.name: Shaintar: Legends Unleashed
183623.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Every great tale has a beginning, and yours begins here, in the realm of Shaintar. At once familiar and alien, you will come to know it as a place you understand completely, while still being perplexed and dazzled by its mysteries. As you seek out the answers to those mysteries, all the while doing battle with villains and monsters both archetypal and alien, you will come to understand a primal truth: Shaintar, this world with thousands of years of history behind it, stands on the brink of dramatic, possibly catastrophic change. How this change ultimately manifests, what damage it will wreak, or what growth it will engender, will depend entirely upon you. Shaintar is a complete fantasy-themed campaign setting designed for use with the Savage Worlds Deluxe Rules. It is also a very complete source of fantasy gaming material for anyone who wants to enhance their SW fantasy experience.

183625.name: The Widening Gyre: A Savage Steampunk Setting
183625.description:
From the back cover:

Welcome to the 19th Century
...that never was!

It is a world of wonder, of horror, of adventure, of magic, of strange technology and unprecedented cultural revolution. This is an age that should have been, filled with radium-powered flying machines, clockwork automata, and steam-driven computers. It is an age of dark magic, sinister secrets, and unholy cults. It is a time in which the world teeters on the edge of chaos, where the enlightened scientific mind battled against ancient superstition and ignorance, in which the souls of all mankind hung in the balance.

The Widening Gyre presents a glimpse at the Industrial Age as it truly was, envisioned by those far-sighted luminaries and Savants who looked beyond the feeble limitations of man and created a world in which science, technology, and logic triumphed over the mundane physical limitations of the Universe. And yet, Logic’s victory is far from complete. This is also a dark and gothic world, where monsters from ages long past still prowl and men with evil motives call upon ancient sorceries to grant them the power to control the world. The Widening Gyre is a world in which you’ll play consulting detectives and adventuring academics, occultist thrill-seekers and Savants both heroic and insane, all working for a secretive organization of benevolent technologists who seek to prevent the dark monsters of humanity’s past from overwhelming its bright and burgeoning future.

Welcome to The Widening Gyre!

The Savage Worlds Deluxe rules are required to play. (This is a rewritten version of The Widening Gyre which was written for the HERO System (6th Edition).)

183626.name: Internal Affairs
183626.description:
A team of infiltrators from the triad penetrated the police force. However, the police also has sent a team of undercover agents to infiltrate the triad. Ten years later, they are still undercover, but their minds have been twisted by the temptation of power, authority and money — and nobody is certain about their original roles anymore. Both groups learn that they have been infiltrated and want to ferret out the moles. Each mole has a secret code to lock their identity file, and once the code is cracked their identity is fully revealed. The battle of wits starts now. Either exposing the enemy or taking the chance to change the identity for good can save their lives as long as nobody knows who is who!

Internal Affairs is an intense elimination game between infiltrators from both the Triad and the Police Force Infiltrator. Each player has a set of secret ID cards which determine that player's allegiance. Each player also has a secret code, which when cracked reveals the player's real ID. At the beginning of the game, each player has five code cards and chooses three of them to be the secret code that locks the identity file. During their turn, players try to crack other players' codes to find out who is who and get their team to victory. Due to action cards, though, ID cards may be passed from player to player and this may change each player's allegiance. Players must be quick to win, as otherwise they may end up in the losing team when they least expect it.

Internal Affairs is designed for 5-8 players, but alternative rules have been included to allow for play with 2-4.

183627.name: Ormen Långe
183627.description: Ormen Långe is a children's game where the players roll a die with different colors on the sides, telling which square to go to. If the square has a snake piece on it, the player can collect this and add to his snake to make it longer. The player with the longest snake at the end of the game is the winner.

183628.name: FlitsQuiz
183628.description:
Het Supersnelle Kennisspel.
