A quiz game for kids from the primary school. They test their knowledge about school-topics and earn victory points by answering multiple choice questions correctly. There are ways to steal points from other players too.

The objective is to gain the most number of victory points after a predetermined number of questions.

183629.name: Freelance Traveller (Issue 69 - Sep 2015)
rpgissuearticle: Doing It My Way: Generating NPC Psychology
Kurishdam: Jump Destination: Evansion and Korranion
Raconteurs’ Rest: Funny Fish: Changes of Mind, Part 1
Up Close and Personal: Lock Thornadon
183629.description:
From the Contents page:

Freelance Traveller #069: September 2015

Cover: Shawn Driscoll

Freelance Traveller is published monthly in PDF form by the editor. The current issue is available from Freelance Traveller's web site.

183631.name: The Game Without Decency
183631.description:
Draw and read a scenario card out loud. Players each select the cards from their hands that they think will win them the round. The person that read the scenario picks her favorite card for the scenario. The person that was picked gets a point and reads the next scenario card.

The player with the most points (White Cards) at the end of the game is the winner.

183634.name: Revansch
183634.description: Revansch is a real-estate game, where player starts with low capital and collects sets of properties and invests to industry. The player moves around the board trying to visit places like bank, stockmarket and salary. The winner is the only player left after the other players left the game due to bankruptcy.

183635.name: Treasure Island
183635.description: Treasure Island is a roll-and-move game where players hunt for pirate treasure. It is included in The Great Pirate Activity Book, published by Kingfisher. There are four starting points, each marked by a ship and leading to a different track. Each player chooses a ship and places his or her starting marker on it. More than one player may choose the same ship. Players take turns rolling the die and moving their marker along the track, following the directions on spaces where they land. Spaces may move players forward or back on the track or cause gain of loss of turns. When a player reaches the pirate treasure on an exact roll, he or she then heads back the starting ship. The first player back to his or her starting ship wins.

183637.name: Monkeys Ahoy!
183637.description:
Monkeys Ahoy! is a mobile game in cartoon-style anchored on the App Store, where chimps are fighting Monkey Pirates to get their stolen fruits back.

Join two young pirates on their quest to make the ultimate friendship smoothy through this bright, lively and wild monkey world. Monkeys Ahoy! is a match 3 game with a twist where players can connect pirate treasures by drawing the longest line possible through the same shapes and colors.

The game allows for unique combos and chaining as you jump between shape and color to continue the chain. Easy to play and learn with the added fun of trying to make the longest chain through all the pirate goodies!

Source: The Game Website.

183638.name: White Night
videogamehonor: 2014 AzPlay Awards Best Game Design Nominee
2014 AzPlay Awards Most Original Game Idea Nominee
2015 SXSW Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
183638.description:
User summary

A horror-themed puzzle adventure game on an 1930s America backdrop, where the player walks around in a haunted house trying to solve the riddles and mystery of the mansion's past and get out alive. In order to keep his sanity, the protagonist must constantly find a light source.
The game is presented in extreme-sharp black and white (literally almost only those two colours; no grayscales), giving a comic book feel.

183639.name: Dennis the Menace
183639.description:
Often confused with Dennis the Menace and Gnasher, this is actually a very different game of set collection and movement.
Players are required to move around the board to different locations, collecting Menace and mischief cards while avoid Dad and the Slipper! The location cards all require a different number and combination of Menace cards to be completed and the first to complete a set number is the winner!

183640.name: GemPacked
183640.description:
GemPacked is a refreshing iOS puzzler packed with gems, brilliant colors, and celestial forces! A natural extension for Apple and iOS lovers who are familiar with sorting and managing app icons on the home screen, GemPacked creates an original and memorable game experience.

Source: The Developer Website.

183641.name: Misfits in Action (Issue 2.9 - Sep 2015)
rpgissuearticle: What's Going On with Misfit Studios
183641.description:
From publisher blurb:

The monthly newsletters by Misfit Studios presents news regarding what is going on with the company, recaps the products it released during the previous month, and offers a product promotion.

183642.name: Snitch
183642.description:
There’s a Snitch in the Mafia, and the Godfather has ordered us to take him out! Snitch is a hidden identity card game set in the world of the mafia, played with 4-6 friends in about 15 to 30 minutes. Play as the Mobster and attempt to whack the Snitch. Or play as the Snitch, and frame the mobsters so they turn on each other! Watch out for the Police, as they can be tipped off towards anyone. If we don't whack the Snitch in time, he's sure to get into protective custody!

A round consists of a hit being placed on one of the players. Whether or not they’re a Snitch is for you to decide. Use cards in your hand to attack, or protect the target. Cash can be used to influence the hit in either direction! If enough damage is dealt to a player, they can be sent to the hospital, or whacked!

Players take part in Mob Jobs. If the job is snitched on, the game gets more difficult for the Mobsters, and the Snitch gets closer to protective custody. The deck also consists of mafia associates, who's skills can be used to further your agenda.

The Mobsters win if they whack the Snitch! The Snitch wins if enough Mobsters are whacked, or if enough police are in play!

183643.description:
Description from the publisher:

The players travel around Jeju Island, the most beautiful island in Korea, and gather treasure tiles along the way. By gathering treasure tiles in Play Jeju, players can collect point cards with special effects. The player with the most points wins!
183643.name: Jeju Island
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 159

183644.name: Ascension: Cetra, Benefactor of All Promo
boardgameexpansion: Ascension: Darkness Unleashed
Ascension: Dawn of Champions
Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
Ascension: Immortal Heroes
Ascension: Realms Unraveled
Ascension: Return of the Fallen
Ascension: Rise of Vigil
Ascension: Storm of Souls
183644.description:
Promo card from Gencon 2015

Cost: 5 Runes

Lifebound Hero

Starting with you, and then going in turn order, each player acquires a Hero without paying its cost. The Heroes acquired this way are put on top of their owner's deck

3 Honor

183645.name: Ascension: Nyxian Corruptor Promo
boardgameexpansion: Ascension: Darkness Unleashed
Ascension: Dawn of Champions
Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
Ascension: Immortal Heroes
Ascension: Realms Unraveled
Ascension: Return of the Fallen
Ascension: Rise of Vigil
Ascension: Storm of Souls
183645.description:
Promo card from Gencon 2015

Cost: 6 Runes

Void Hero

Gain 3 Power
You may spend 3 runes as thought it was power this turn

3 Honor

183646.name: Ascension: Sadistic Laboratory Promo
boardgameexpansion: Ascension: Darkness Unleashed
Ascension: Dawn of Champions
Ascension: Deckbuilding Game
Ascension: Immortal Heroes
Ascension: Realms Unraveled
Ascension: Return of the Fallen
Ascension: Rise of Vigil
Ascension: Storm of Souls
183646.description:
Promo card from Gencon 2015

Cost: 6 Runes

Void Construct

Once per turn, gain 1 Power
When you defeat a monster in the center row, banish any monster under this and place the defeated monster under this. You may defeat the monster under this as though it were in the center row. If this leaves play, banish any monsters under this.

3 Honor

183647.name: P.O.L.L.E.N
videogamehonor: 2016 SXSW Gamer's Voice: Best Indie Game of the Year (Single player) Nominee
183647.description:
User Summary

Set on a space station on Titan, an incident has occurred and the Rama Industries who manage the station are looking for a new employee. That employee is you, and it is up to you to investigate what has happened.

183648.name: Gran Jefe Indio
183648.description:
Translated from the back of the Finnish edition box:

TOM tom tom TOM tom tom ... tactful Native American drumming raises the atmosphere, the cards turn, drumming stops and the race to find the right image begins! The one who is the fastest, slaps their hand on the right card and wins the plume into his Indian headband.

The first to get five plumes into his headband will be the Great Chief, and he wins the game!

183649.name: Escape the Nightmare
183649.description:
A challenging fifty four card cooperative real time trading game (With optional singing).

You play as a group of friends inhabiting a shared nightmare. Your hand consists of nightmarish aspects and you goal is to trade these with your friends. If someone can get a collection of similar aspects then they can master that part of the nightmare and contribute to your eventual escape - however each card that you receive in trade can force you to undertake certain actions, restrict who you trade with or limit how you can communicate. To make matters worse something is chasing you through the nightmare and you have to trade its card every ten seconds or be devoured. It's coming. Run.

During set-up players choose a collection of nightmare types based on the number of players. This choice allows a group to include or exclude certain mechanics - so whether your nightmare will be an all singing all dancing nightmare is down to the exuberance of the players rather than luck of the draw.

Escape the Nightmare is a challenging experience, with the average group losing a fair few games before their first victory. However the play time is quick and resetting for another go takes seconds. There are six difficulty levels to make the game accessible for groups of any level of skill and selecting different types of nightmare allows players to set the tone of their game to suit their preferences.

183650.description:
First edition:

Need someone to take the blame when you stab your buddy in the back? Look no further! The new Munchkin Vinyl Figure from Funko will keep all the orcs at bay, ruin miniatures gaming, and probably won't spontaneously combust! Huzzah! Includes a new exclusive Munchkin card!
183650.name: Munchkin Vinyl Figure: Dopple Spyke
boardgameexpansion: Munchkin

183651.name: Jeu du Cirque
183651.description: Jeu du Cirque is a board game that is played in 15 minutes. It consists of a board, 4 pawns and 2 dice, each for a different level reached on he board, with colours and pictures on the die sides. Players roll the dice and advance their tokens along the board, like in Snakes and Ladders. Depending on the square that they end up on, they can either ride along the neck of the giraffe and win tickets, or descend on the trapeze and fall back several spaces. The winner is the player who arrives first at the circus tent, at the top of the board.

183652.name: Fish, Fish, Squish!
183652.description:
From the publisher:

The squish or be squished family game. Will you be the last player with the unsquished fish? Start the game with your own school of dough-fish. Flip cards in turn until you complete a three-in-a-row. When you do, you are awarded a "free squish" of any opponent's fish. Stay on your fins! Everyone is trying to squish your fish too! Last "fish" standing wins!

183653.name: La Quête des Chevaliers
boardgamefamily: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
183653.description:
La Quête des Chevaliers (Knights' Quest) is a boardgame that is primarily a memory mechanic game.

The two players face each other, both players must remember the location of the Excalibur swords and dragons laid about the board. Then they close their eyes, moving their finger on the plateau to reach the castle of their opponent without touching a dragon. And when they find Excalibur, they win gold coins. Players must therefore memorize the course and stay well focused. The winner is the player who wins the most coins by reaching the other's castle.

183654.name: Devine Super Héros
183654.description: Devine Super Héros is a game of memory and deduction. Each game lasts 15 minutes. Among a hand of 16 cards, each player chooses a character and places it on a stand before them, hidden from their opponent. By asking each other questions, each player must guess the Super Hero chosen by the other player. The first to guess the other's superhero wins! This plays very similarly to Guess Who.

183656.name: Animal Merry-Go-Round Motor Skill Game
183656.description: An excellent addition to the My First Play World series from HABA, the ' Animal Merry-Go-Round Motor Skill Game will be both fun and educational for your little one! Each animal has his home. The cheeky friends, however, have a lot of fun with the turning disk and love to change places! Who can return order to the jumble? To do so, little zoo friends need a good touch and some luck at turning the seesaw. Specially designed to foster motor skills and introduce the concept of games with instructions. This set includes fun game ideas to keep little ones entertained for longer. Made in Germany, the board and tiles are sturdy cardboard and the pieces are made of beech wood. The game includes 1 elephant (3.00" tall), 1 lion, 1 zebra, 1 flamingo, 1 monkey, 1 rotatable seesaw, 10 play tiles, 1 game board, set of instructions. Perfect for children ages 2 years and up.

183658.description:
From deep within the wastelands, far from the Golden City comes a new breed of survivors. Forged in the most desolate conditions these opportunistic individuals prowl the ruins watching for passers-by – to either join or exploit.

Skilled nomads, these ‘Hitchhikers’ can twist any situation to their advantage, whether through silver-tongued and honeyed words or brute force and lethal cunning. Having been bred far from the Golden City, some Hitchhikers have only recently heard of the glittering utopia and many have made their way across hundreds of miles, braving unimaginable dangers and hardships for a chance to learn more about this potential prize.

Some consider the Hitchhikers to be parasites that latch onto and leech from others, but for them it is a way of life and the ultimate path to survival. They are wild rovers, moving from one opportunity to the next in search of the last big pay-off… But they are not the only ones who come from the shadows.. Riders & gangs, rebels & outlanders are rising in the wastelands. They tried to enter the Golden City, but they were stopped by the Forces and now they are exiled for ever in the wastelands. Anyone who is trying to reach the Golden City, has to face them and their minions!
183658.name: Raid & Trade: War on the Streets
boardgameexpansion: Raid & Trade
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 65: Batter Up! (aka mermaids)

183659.name: Charades Mini Game
183659.description: Cha-rades? Hey, what's that? Charades is a way of describing things without using words and by using only gestures, facial expressions and body movements. The aim of the game is to guess as many of the things acted out during the game as fast as possible. Classic fun for all ages! Includes blank cards so you can act out whatever you like. Portable Version in a tin by HABA!

183660.description:
Explore lands where no other explorer has yet set foot. Is this cold, brutal land inhabited? And if so, by what?

This expansion contains 96 additional cards that will greaten the size of the Continent and offer you a new curse to unravel!
183660.name: The 7th Continent: The Icy Maze
boardgameexpansion: The 7th Continent

183665.name: Squish'Em!: Fantasy
183665.description:
Four adventurers. Four attacks... but only one will slay the monster.

In Squish’em!: Fantasy – you will play the Elf, the Summoner, the Barbarian and the Speller against more than 20 different monsters : a Cute Lil Bunny, a Cockatrice, a Manotaur, a Hat Golem, a Boy scout…

These “monsters” (often cute or funny) are too terrorized to counter-attack, but be careful because the other players want the same thing you want : give the coup de grâce to that adorable little creature.

Your goal is simple : be the first to slay 3 creatures.

Unfortunately, you can collide with other players or find your attacks cancelled by a monster or player's effect.

Squish’em!: Fantasy is the first game of the series Squish’em! All these games are stand-alone and can also be mixed to play with more heroes and more monsters.

Components : Box - Rules - 66 cards

183666.name: Quiz-It
183666.description:
A Bible trivia game translated from the Dutch game Kwistet. 396 questions about people, places, and events of the Bible.
Answering questions correctly allows players to move their pieces around a Pachisi-like board; the winner is the one to get both playing pieces 'home' first.

Two decks of cards provide different difficulty levels; a third deck (for children) is available separately.

183667.description:
Game Idea

All the thieves in town will compete today in “Memo Extreme”. The task is to find two identical pieces of loot. To begin, two of the thief cards facing down are turned over. If two identical objects are revealed, the player can keep the pair of cards face down in front of him. But watch out! Your loot is not safe as the other players can still steal it from you.
Whoever has collected the most thief cards at the end of a round, receives a bag of loot. Whoever has an extremely good memory and is the first to collect two bags of loot, will be honored as the “master thief”.

Preparation

Shuffle the 21 thief cards with the blue backside and distribute them face down in the center of the table. Make sure no cards overlap. Get the bags of loot ready. The thief cards with the green backside remain in the game box. They will be needed for the second round.

How to Play

Play in a clockwise direction. Whoever most resembles the thief on the backside of the cards may start. If you cannot agree the oldest player starts.

You have two options:
1. Turn over two cards. If as yet no player has found a pair, you can only choose this option. Turn over two cards from the center. Have you turned over two identical pieces of loot?

Yes? - Great! Take the two cards and place them face down in front of you.
No? - Pity! All the players try to remember the pieces of loot. Then you turn the cards back over again.




2. Turn over a card and inquire with another player
You can only choose this option if at least one of the other players has already found a pair. Turn over a card from the center. Point to one of the two pieces of loot and say the name of the player who you think has this piece of loot represented among his cards.

The player in question secretly checks to see if he does.

The player has the corresponding piece of loot? Great! He must to give you the corresponding card. Now you can keep both cards placed face down in front of you.
The player does not have the corresponding piece of loot? Pity! Turn over the card in the center.




Then it’s the turn of the next player.

End of Round

A round ends as soon as there is no card left in the center. The
player who collected the most cards receives a bag of loot. In case of a draw, various players receive a bag. A new round starts Now the deck of cards with the blue backside is returned to the box and a second round is played with the green cards.
If you want to play more than two rounds, swap the deck of cards
after each round.

End of the game

As soon as a player collects his second bag of loot, he has won the game. If various players receive a second bag at the same time, they share the victory.
183667.name: Extrem-Memo

183669.name: Act of Aggression
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
183669.description:
Set in the near-future, Act Of Aggression is a techno-thriller real-time strategy game hailing from the Golden Era of RTS: the nineties and noughties. Across three distinct factions each armed with the greatest modern and prototyped military weaponry, head into some of the world's most volatile conflict zones, building bases for mass production, establishing resource supply lines, and waging war with increasing veterancy in Eugen Systems' - creators of the million selling Wargame series - explosive new RTS.

Throughout large, authentic maps, players will harvest resources, build bases strategically, defend them, and produce all kinds of units to match the wit of their opponent. Extend your base network with off-base refineries for harvesting resources, and protect supply networks ensuring a stable income of cash and minerals. You'll even fight other players for occupied banks as a supplementary income, and capture soldiers surviving crews ejected from destroyed tanks and planes or wounded soldiers on the battlefield to take as prisoners of war.


Three technologically varied and powerful factions each with their own skills and strengths Weapons, vehicles and armaments based on real life or near-future prototype equipment
Huge life-like maps across a war-torn political landscape
Fight for natural resources and cash to keep the wheels of war turning
Capture prisoners of war and ransom them back to your enemy
Occupy banks as supplementary income
Set up supply lines and strategically build your base to match your strategy
Thwart nuclear attacks tactical weapons with missile defenses, or bomb your enemy out of the fight!
A classical RTS experience paying homage to the Golden Era of RTS, the 90's and early 00's.


Source: The Game Website.

183671.name: Hideous Creatures: Hunting Horror
183671.description:
[publisher blurb]

"I see it—coming here—hell-wind—titan blur—black wings—Yog-Sothoth save me—the three-lobed burning eye. . . ."

Avatar or servitor, this winged and coiling horror haunts the dark and hunts those who seek it out. Shine a little light on this most shadowy of creatures!

183673.name: Mulmaster Bonds & Backgrounds
183673.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

Download the Mulmaster Bonds and Backgrounds pdf that features bonds and backgrounds you can choose for a character that hails from Mulmaster or recently from Phlan. These backgrounds are legal for use in D&D Adventurers League games for characters with the Elemental Evil story origin. Created by campaign RCs, Robert Alaniz, Arthur Severance, and Derek Gray, with help from Frank Foulis and Jon Lamkin.

User Summary:

A 6-page PDF that expands the State of Mulmaster Article with a localised set of 20 bonds, and some additional options for character backgrounds:

Caravan Specialist
Earthspur Miner
Harborfolk
Mulmaster Aristocrat
Phlan Refugee

183676.name: N30N City Rumble: Final Boss
boardgameexpansion: N30N City RUMBLE
183676.description:
Final Boss is the long awaited mini expansion for the base game:

It adds 3 new fighters, an entire new mode (co op) 3 new "boss cards" and new type of cards to be used in the new mode.

The package is small but it adds a lot to the base game

183677.description:
San Francisco, 1981. The city is experiencing a surge in violence, and the popular local group of superheroes, "The Guardians" can not cope. They are looking for a new recruit.

Each of the players will be in the shoes of one of the rookie heroes who intend to join "The Guardians". To do this they will have their abilities (each will be specialized in one of the four - Strength, Speed, Elements and psychic) and Heroic Resources (cards).

The test is to undergo a normal day in the city, solving real missions. Which achieved more (and more important) missions, who will stay with the job.

Each turn the First Player will show several missions. Each player will place a bid for the mission he wants. Every player will face one mission per turn, and try to fulfill it.
To get it you will use as many dice as your main characteristic for this mission, and you can negotiate and use bonus cards to do it easier.

The hero with the most Mission Points will win, and will join "The Guardians".
183677.name: Rookie Heroes

183679.description:
Card filler on the mechanics of "rock-paper-scissors."

"The old dungeon of the castle of King Kibertania full of weapons, stones and ancient scrolls. However, the magician Algorimus created evil robots-Golems, who attack anyone who dared to walk through the dungeon. You - a brave knight, whom the king had locked in the dungeon, along with your rivals. Your task - to survive in the dungeon, to preserve and increase your team Knights and collect the most Trophies and destroy more SteamBots"

Players in the game turn-by-turn move tokens of his knights on the game field, consisting of Terrain cards and take the card out of the deck, indicating findings on that place.

It may be Trophies, robots-SteamBots or pieces of another Territory. If two or three players meet on one Terrain card, they fight among themselves for the the findings by the "rock-paper-scissors" card.

The winner is the player that kept more Knights in the team, destroy more STEAMBOTs and earned the most Trophies. For all of this The King get Gold. More Gold - and you are best (and famous) Knight.
183679.name: Knights vs Steambots

183680.name: Big Box Office "The Movie Business Game!"
183680.description:
Big Box Office "The Movie Business Game!" lets you become the Producer, Director, Writer and Agent of a Big Box Office Hollywood movie!

When you arrive in Hollywood, you first go to work. After you make $10,000 you enter the main playing board. As you move your token around the board, you accumulate "Industry Title Rings," such as Black for Producer, Red for Director, Blue for Writer and Green for Agent.

As you go around the board, you accumulate "Movie Titles" when you enter the theatre where the movie is playing. You enter the theatre and multiply your profits depending on how many "Industry Title Rings" you have on your token.

Other squares have "Pick Director (or other industry title) Card." These cards direct you to other areas of the board, which can be good or bad, depending on which "Movie Titles" you have.

You can also land on a "Spin the Wheel" square. This wheel will either give or take away your industry title.

The first person to make $1,000,000 wins the game.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
183682.description:
Orléans: Invasion, the first large expansion for the award-winning game "Orléans", contains six scenarios, new buildings, and several new event-cards. The scenarios were designed by Reiner Stockhausen and Inka & Markus Brand:


"Prosperity": A classic expansion for 2-5 players including new buildings and introducing the carpenter, designed by Inka and Markus Brand.



"Invasion": A co-operative scenario for 2-5 players in which the players have to fend off an invasion and fulfill personal goals to win, designed by Inka and Markus Brand.



"The Duel": A scenario for two players in which both opponents have to complete four objectives to win, designed by Reiner Stockhausen.


In addition, Orléans: Invasion contains three solo-challenges by Reiner Stockhausen.


"The Dignitary": is a solo scenario in which you are an important dignitary trying to gather as many citizens as possible.



"Capital Vierzon": is another solo scenario challenging you to develop Vierzon to become the capital of its region.



"Travelling Salesman": the solo player plays the role of a salesman travelling through the country and delivering valuable goods to the farthest of places.
183682.name: Orléans: Invasion
boardgameexpansion: Orléans
Orléans: Deluxe Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 19: Orleans Review - Boards Alive Interview - Free Games
Episode 31: The Networks Review + Gencon 2016 Preview
Episode 42 - Unpub 7 Experiences and Gloomhaven Impressions
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 66!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 70!!
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80
WIPNcast 106

183683.name: Space Yoghurt
boardgameversion: Space Yoghurt the Board Game Limited Premiere Edition
183683.description:
Space Yoghurt is a competitive game for two to four space adventurers. By rolling dice and making use of the moon's strategic places, the player maneuvers his or her crew into the spaceship's cockpit and strives to win the cosmic vacation. Will you be the one who receives the Golden Ticket from the Galactic Empress Yolibolibana III?

Each player has a crew of three spaceters and takes turn to roll the three crew dice to move along the moon track. If you end up on a Bouncy Crater you can make haste and bounce all the way to the cockpit, soaring past the other spaceters. Ending up on a Yoghurt Pool gives you special powers, but the Space Yoghurt is wacky strong and must be handled with care. It might win you the game, sending other players' spaceters home or be so bitter that you must go home and rest for a while. Easy rules, fast play and big wins! See you out there, brave space adventurers!

183684.name: Pinball Showdown
183684.description: This game has been removed from our schedule and replaced with Pinball Showdown.

183685.description:
Mr. President is a solitaire game about governing as the President of the United States. It's not an election game. It begins after you've been elected. It's about sitting in The Chair and trying to advance your agenda while navigating ongoing crises, political enemies, public opinion, your relations with Congress and the press, and keeping your country secure in a world of rival nations and agendas that just seems to keep blowing up around you. Mr. President is a resource management game, where you never have enough resources to achieve your entire agenda, and the path you take through an always unpredictable storyline rests on the choices you make. Depending on the results of those choices, and on the unfolding of a "different every game" story, you'll either be thinking "POTUS? Piece of Cake!" or "Why was it that I WANTED this job?" many times in each game.

Like the actual President, you'll have an array of allies and resources to help you as you navigate both the corridors of power in the nation's capital and the uncertainties of international relations. These allies and resources will vary from game to game, but you'll always be able to rely on your Secretary of State and Secretary of Defense to help you with foreign policy and with the use, where you deem necessary, of the combat power of the U.S. military. You'll also have a bevy of domestic advisors and friends in Congress to help you navigate the many challenges in Congress and domestic life and politics. And you'll always have access to at least one truly exceptional talent (this, too, will vary from game to game), someone who excels in their particular job and is a "force multiplier" for you in their own unique way. How you lead and utilize this mix of talents and experience at your disposal will go a long way toward determining your success or failure during your shot at being Mr. President.

Game Play

The Map. The game map allows you to see and track the domestic and world situation that the game creates. It is divided into sections:

1. Congress. This is where you track progress of legislation, as well as keep track of your friends and opponents in Congress.

2. Advisors and Assets. This section of the map is a holding area for all of your advisors, available action points, and military assets.

3. Crisis Management. This is where you manage the Crisis Cards and keep track of crisis status and how well you've dealt with each crisis.

4. The World portion of the map (about half of the map) is divided into eight world regions, with additional sections for Russia and China (your key potential antagonists in the game). Here's a look at the South America Region, as an example of the regional displays:

Crisis Cards. At the heart of Mr. President are the 150+ Crisis Cards that help create the storyline for each game. These cards - see the 12 sample cards on this page - are a mix of cards representing Domestic or World Crises, Terrorism Events, Unexpected Benefits, and Opportunities. The Crisis Cards help drive, but do not completely control, the storyline in each game. Here's how it works:

Each game of Mr. President is divided into eight turns, each representing six months in office. These turns are further divided into six Rounds, each representing one month.

At the start of each turn, you get to perform assessment and planning actions, where you get to lay out your rough plan, re-examine strategy, re-evaluate the threats and opportunities that were presenting as the previous turn ended (or at game start). So there is definitely a proactive strategy piece to the game. Unfortunately, though, your plans are not often going to survive intact once the turn gets going. The world stage is a dynamic platform.

Once you have your plans made (and the Mr. President gods laugh at you!), you perform the six monthly rounds in order. During each round, you draw three Crisis Cards that represent that main world or domestic events that happen (these are usually bad from your point of view, but occasionally they are events or resources that help you) during that month. Most of the events on the Crisis Cards present you with both an urgent problem that may immediately alter the board state, and a longer term issue that may linger and cause you pain down the road if you don't address it well.

After you flip and resolve the three Crisis Cards for the round, you get to take actions, using any of your available personnel and resources. These actions allow you to make progress on your legislative agenda, attempt to address any new crises presented by the round's three actions cards, deal with any lingering world or domestic issues, fight terrorism, perform diplomacy, and attempt to better your situation in the world or in the eyes of the American people.

Once you finish your action portion of the round, that round (month) is finished, and you move on to the next round, drawing three new Crisis Cards and repeating the round process until the 6-month turn is complete.

Seeded within the 18-card mix that makes up a turn, you have six cards for Russian and Chinese Actions, Terror Actions, War Progress, Crisis Checks, and White House Life. You know that each of these six cards will show up sometime during each turn, but you don't know when. The variable timing of these cards' appearance each turn adds uncertainty and spice to the game, while ensuring that major players in the game present challenges for you every single turn. Russia and China offer deeper challenges, with four possible postures (aggression levels) for each country and a country-specific AI for each. Postures may shift in-game in response to your actions or to storyline events, making dealing positively with each nation an evolving challenge all game.

Please note that Mr. President is NOT a "beer and pretzels" surface-level game. This game is intended to be deep and immersive, one that will both frustrate and delight the solitaire player. Playing time is four to eight hours (depending on your experience level) to play an entire 4-year term. I've tried to pack as much fun as possible into each 6-month turn, so that even if you only have time to play one turn on a weeknight, you'll be engaged, frustrated, challenged, and immersed throughout. That said, I hope you're going to find it difficult to stop playing after each turn. I've designed Mr. President to be an experience that will wrap you up in each new game's story, and beckon you back to the game table after each round, turn, or completed game.

I designed this game to provide massive replayability. With over 150 Crisis cards in the mix, and multiple subsystems representing the US Economy, Congress, Homeland Security, the Press, Presidential Prestige, Russia, China, Hostile Rogue States, and staunch Allies, no two games of Mr. President will ever play remotely alike. If you think you're ready for that challenge, go ahead. Raise your right hand and swear the oath. Then settle in behind the desk in the Oval Office, and let your imagination run wild!

I hope playing Mr. President brings you as much enjoyment as designing it has brought me!

- Gene

Components

22 x 34” mounted game board
165 Cards
600 counters and markers
rulebook
playbook
six card stock player aid cards
one ten-sided and two six-sided dice
183685.name: Mr. President
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 42 :: Board Game of the Year 2016 - Brawling Brothers Awards

183687.name: New Heroes/Villains: Sparkles the Unicorn
183687.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sparkles is a legend among base raiders, both heroic and villainous. An immortal unicorn able to heal the sick, imbue others with magical powers, and run faster than a speeding car, Sparkles has used his abilities to spread chaos across the world. He has saved the lives of children and given madmen superhuman abilities just to see what they can do. Is he a hero or a villain? No one knows but you can find out! This supplement contains:

Stats for Sparkles as a hero and as a villain! Decide what Sparkles will be for your campaign.
The heroic Sparkles is playable, easy to use as a new player character!
A new magical power source: Blessings of the Unicorn. *Sparkles can give people permanent super powers.
Unicorn-forged artifacts can be used by villains and ruthless base raiders.
Adventure seed: The Hunt for the Wild Horn

183688.name: Cinematic Dinosaurs Volume II
183688.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dinosaurs As They Were Always Meant to Be!

Dinosaurs occupy a special place in our imagination. On the one hand, they are awe-inspiring creatures of myth and fantasy, terrible draconic creatures which no human has ever lain eyes upon, stars of novels, television, and movies. On the other hand, they were real, mundane animals, not so different from the animals we know in modern day times. As a result, dinosaurs occupy a nebulous space between fantasy and reality, and require a delicate balance to handle well.

The dinosaurs included in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Bestiary do an excellent job of presenting one interpretation of dinosaurs: that of being large, but nonetheless mundane animals, differing from a bear or elephant only in Hit Dice and size category. Like other animals, they receive little in the way of special abilities or mechanics to make them come alive at the game table. With Weekly Wonders: Cinematic Dinosaurs Volume II, we present a different interpretation of dinosaurs, one which draws on the more fantastical elements of these creatures, as seen in movies, television, games, and more. Though they are decidedly non-magical in nature, these dinosaurs can hardly be said to be mundane, with numerous new and exciting special abilities designed to evoke the sorts of action attributed to dinosaurs in other media.

In this book, you will find:

The primordial pteranodon (CR 5), with a deadly, razor-sharp beak, a terrifying penchant for dive-bombing, and the ability to easily carry off creatures of nearly their own size into the air, to devour at leisure at their nest
The primordial brontosaurus (CR 13), whose bulk allows it to destroy even towering structures with a gesture, and whose massive tail is a terror to behold on the field of battle.
Supplemental rules applicable to all dinosaurs and other creatures of immense size, which address the common problem of one could ever hope to kill such creatures by stabbing their toes, and providing extensive rules for climbing massive creatures, and fighting them from a precarious vantage point on the very body of one's foe.

183689.name: Warbirds Mission Cards
183689.description:
From publisher blurb:

Warbirds Mission Cards offer a quick and easy way for GMs to determine their pilots’ next mission. Each card provides a location, risk level, payment, duration, and brief summary of what the players can expect. The cards act as a jumping off point for the GM to take your Warbirds game in exciting new directions.

Mission Cards are available as Print-and-Play PDFs and as Print-On-Demand cards.

Print-On-Demand decks come with 52 mission cards, two blank cards for custom GM missions, and a rules card detailing their use in play. The deck also comes with a free version of the Print-and-Play PDF.

Print-And-Play decks come with 52 mission cards, a rules page, and 12 Extra blank cards for the GM to create custom missions.

183690.name: Book of Putrescence
183690.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bloom is a feature film in which Lily (Deann Baker) wakes up in a bloody motel bathroom with fuzzy memories of the previous night. As she copes with her trauma and struggles to figure out what happened, she begins changing into something inhuman.

The Bloom Role-Playing Game, published in association with Aegis Studios, allows players to step into the world of Bloom and explore the themes introduced in the film.

The Book of Putrescence, is a collection of system options for use with the Bloom Role-Playing Game, including new systems for Putrescence and Redemption, five new Vampiric Feats and six new Putrescent Feats!

183691.name: The Super Villain Handbook (Basic Edition - Fate)
183691.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's true, super villains are a secretive lot. Other than the occasional slip of megalomania during world domination broadcasts, most super villains keep the essence of who they are and what they do under tight wraps. Dr. Comics (That would be Dr Tondro... Shh. It's a secret) has tapped every informant, minion, and ex-villainous love interest he could get his hooks into to divulge the secrets of what makes a super villain tick.

The Super Villain Handbook covers forty archetypes for various super villains that one might encounter throughout comics. While the book was created with ICONS in mind, there are many reasons that this is an essential resource for GMs of any superhero game.

The book classifies super villains not by what they can do (for example, "control magnetism") but by their role in the story ("I must make the world safe for my people!"). In such roles, we see everything from the lowly Crime Boss to the Cosmic Menace. This allows villains of all types and power sets to fill different roles at the table without coming across as poorly re-skinned clones.

183692.name: The Curse of Widow's Cape
183692.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini Quests by Survive RPG offer compelling 2-6 page adventures that are great for a one-off session, convention play or for use as a side quest to your campaign. Mini-Quests is designed for any D20 fantasy system.

In THE CURSE OF WIDOW'S CAPE the characters must uncover the mystery of a powerful enchantment that causes any who hear its keening wail to cast themselves into the sea. Will the characters surive?

183693.name: Tholy the Fugitive
183693.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prince Priogrim was forced to accept a House of Lords as a co-equal branch of government. And the first decree declared Tholy the Divine a capital criminal. But the wily, corrupt of head of the Inquisition saw the problem coming. He has looted the Inquisition treasury and fled Odill. Can the PCs recover Tholy and the loot? A D&D 5th edition adventure for 1-8 8th level characters. Episode 1 in The New Odill series.

183694.name: Revolt at the Spire
183694.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Sci-Fi RPG Mini-Adventure
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 3-5
You’re headed to the Crystalspire Resort on Elysian Fields, delivering an antique piano to some big-shot performer for some easy credits. It isn’t until the “Maestro’s” dress rehearsal that things start to get complicated.

Revolt at the Spire is part of a series of mini-adventures designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side missions or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

183695.name: Hirelings & Followers
183695.description:
From publisher blurb:

Too often players forget that they can pay for the help of hirelings or, if they have the Leadership feat, followers that can aid them. Sometimes these characters are treated as little better than dragon-fodder. This Sidebar introduces a streamlined method of getting clear in-game benefits of having various hirelings or followers with your character.

183696.name: Ghost Ship of the Desert Dunes
183696.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure in Hyperborea designed for from four to six characters of 2nd through 4th level

Somewhere in the depths of Diamond Desert lie the skeletal remains of Ymir’s Serpent, a legendary Viking longship. In days of yore, Sigtrygg Forkbeard led his company upriver, piercing the desert’s hostile heart. There the Vikings unearthed a lost mine brimming with green diamonds, but the River Æolus desiccated as the Serpent prepared for launch, and the ship was swallowed by the dunes. Forkbeard and his company were never seen again, but tales of a shimmering Viking ghost ship gliding over the dunes persist to this day.

Ghost Ship of the Desert Dunes takes players into an action-packed realm of adventure: the mythical world of Hyperborea, a sword-and-sorcery campaign setting inspired by the fantastic fiction of Robert E. Howard, H.P. Lovecraft, Clark Ashton Smith, and others. This adventure is designed for Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea (AS&SH), a role-playing game descended from the original 1974 fantasy wargame and miniatures campaign rules as conceived by E. Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson.

183697.name: Forgotten Fane of the Coiled Goddess
183697.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure in Hyperborea designed for from four to six characters of 5th through 7th level

More than a month ago, your party found itself in Port Zangerios, where you heard of an Esquimaux thief selling a treasure map. Low on wealth but high in courage, you sought him out. The man turned out to be a fearful ex-slave who had “acquired” the map from his Ixian master. The map is incomplete but shews the Isle of the Serpent in far-off Lemuria, where rests a fabulous treasure called the Feathered Crown of Nanasa (or so thought the Ixian). Pooling your money to purchase the unfinished map, you bought passage on an Amazonian trade ship. After passing through tempests and torrential rains that shimmered with auroral light, you have come to the great city of Jhaman Ket. Now you must seek out the location of the Isle of the Serpent.

Forgotten Fane of the Coiled Goddess takes players into an action-packed realm of adventure: the mythical world of Hyperborea, a sword-and-sorcery campaign setting inspired by the fantastic fiction of Robert E. Howard, H.P. Lovecraft, Clark Ashton Smith, and others. This adventure is designed for Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea (AS&SH), a role-playing game descended from the original 1974 fantasy wargame and miniatures campaign rules as conceived by E. Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson.

183698.name: Beneath the Comet
183698.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure in Hyperborea designed for from four to six characters of 6th through 9th level

For weeks the Comet has blazed in the sky above Hyperborea, inspiring widespread superstitious dread and fear of some star-borne contagion. Under the light of this harbinger from the Black Gulf, the PCs have come to Bogrest, following a magical treasure map that reveals great wealth buried in the Lonely Heath north of the village. Finding that treasure will be no simple matter, however, for Hyperborea is a weirder and deadlier place than ever beneath the Comet.

Beneath the Comet takes players into an action-packed realm of adventure: the mythical world of Hyperborea, a sword-and-sorcery campaign setting inspired by the fantastic fiction of Robert E. Howard, H.P. Lovecraft, Clark Ashton Smith, and others. This adventure is designed for Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea (AS&SH), a role-playing game descended from the original 1974 fantasy wargame and miniatures campaign rules as conceived by E. Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson.

183699.description:
In the year 2661, humanity makes contact with a dying alien race, the Mirrugennin, whose survival depends upon a constant influx of a rare substance known as primordium, found only in a remote section of an asteroid field close to the Mirrugennin's home world.

Unfortunately, the feeble Mirrugennin are incapable of acquiring the primordium for themselves, because they would never survive the inevitable encounters with the monstrous Raptezoids and their horrific mother, the Hive Queen, with which the primordium rich asteroids are infested. And so various human factions agree, for a handsome fee, to mine the Primordium for the Mirrugennin, and to battle, and when possible, gather specimens of the Raptezoids for the Mirrugennin to study.

It is not long before the lust for wealth sends these mining factions into conflict with one another, as they each seek to claim more and more asteroids for themselves. Ordinary space miners, most often equipped with nothing more than their trusty pick-axes, have to quickly figure out how to become soldiers as they are sent headlong into bloody battle against the armies of other mining factions. These conflicts become known as the Primoridum Wars, and rage for several years before the Mirrugennin suddenly and mysteriously disappear.

You will play the leader of one these human factions. You will expand your primordium mining operations throughout the asteroid field, fight the terrible Raptezoids, and wage war against your opponents. At the end of five rounds, the player with the most wealth wins the game.

The Primordium Wars is a quasi tile placement and resource gathering game where players place tiles representing various buildings onto their asteroids in order to increase their primordium mining operations. It is also a game in which combat plays a significant, though secondary role, where players attack each other in order to claim more resource producing asteroids, or to disrupt their opponents operations. The game takes place on a modular board where, in each round, players slowly shift the asteroids around on the game board. Because of this, very interesting things can take place, such as: A path is suddenly created leading straight to an opponent's once well protected mining hub, or two players suddenly find that their starships are now in the same sector where a massive space battle is imminent, or an opponent's dangerous class A starship is now cut off.

In each round, players will first acquire, in a bidding phase, tiles that represent the items needed to expand their mining empires such as various asteroid modules to be built on the asteroids (mining facilities, orbital turrets, pulse cannons, science laboratories, etc), various starship upgrades (warp drives, sniping lasers, stealth devices, etc), miner and mercenary reinforcements, build points for building new starships, and grav technology for tethering asteroids together into clusters (a core mechanism that greatly increases mining production, and expands the functionality of most modules built on the asteroids).

Players will then deploy their newly acquired items onto their asteroids and starships, take turns moving their pieces deeper into the asteroid field in order to expand their mining empire, fight Raptezoids and the dreaded Hive Queen, and battle other players through a diceless blind/bluff mechanism in which players that are in conflict secretly and simultaneously make, and then reveal, their battle plans. (This allows for thrilling Operation Bodyguard/Overlord type strategies where you make an opponent think you are attacking HERE, drawing out his forces, but then you really attack HERE, where he is vulnerable.)

Other core mechanisms: The configurations of players' starships are customizable, and kept hidden from opponents, and the more mining facilities built on any particular asteroid, the greater the chance Raptezoids will appear on that asteroid, and hence the greater the chance that they will summon their queen. This is accomplished by die rolls during the "Raptezoid Phase".

At the end of each round players will collect their income from their mining operations and Raptezoid research, and a new round will begin.
183699.name: The Primordium Wars

183700.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Reggiane Re.2001 Falco II was an Italian fighter aircraft. With its flexible design, it proved to be able to undertake a number of roles, from convoy escort to night fighter. Thanks to its maneuverability, it could dogfight with more powerful opponents like the British Supermarine Spitfire. Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards. This is not a complete game. You must own a WW2 Wings of Glory - Starter Set to play.
183700.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Reggiane Re.2001 Falco II
boardgameexpansion: Wings of Glory: WW2 Rules and Accessories Pack
Wings of Glory: WW2 Starter Set
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War

183701.name: GrowthBreaker
183701.description:
From the publisher:

GrowthBreaker. It’s here. The world’s second tabletop novel.

This is a card game for anyone to play alone. It contains whimsical items, enjoyable places, and helpful friends. Your heroes will be challenged in their quest to reach the goals of each season, which are broken up into several serialized decks known as episodes.

The game is also a story. The major plot of GrowthBreaker is always the same, but what you do during the game, and if your survive, is up to you. It can be played an endless amount of times, without ever experiencing the same game twice.

The object of the game is for the player to move a token around the PLACE PILE, acquiring cards out of the DECK as you travel. The more cards you acquire, the stronger your heroes will grow, allowing more powerful cards to be played.

But be warned, the more powerful your heroes become, the more powerful the enemies that will find them.

A game of GrowthBreaker ends when Starting HERO card(s) of the episode is/are Cycled.

183702.description:
From the publisher:

The Yakovlev Yak-1 was a Soviet fighter aircraft. It was extremely maneuverable, fast and well armed, and, just as importantly, it was easy to maintain and reliable. Some Soviet pilots considered it to be, in its tactical and technical characteristics, equal to the Messerschmitt Bf 109G. The Yak-1 was also employed by the elite all-female unit including the most famous fighter pilot woman of all times, Lydia Litvyak. Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory Airplane Pack is a ready-to-play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards. This is not a complete game. You must own a WW2 Wings of Glory - Starter Set to play.
183702.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Yakovlev Yak-1
boardgameexpansion: Wings of Glory: WW2 Rules and Accessories Pack
Wings of Glory: WW2 Starter Set
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War

183703.name: Pantalla del Guardian (Edicion Primigenia)
183703.description:
Keeper's screen for the 6th edition Spanish version.

Pantalla del guardián para la 6ª versión en castellano.

183704.description:
From the publisher:

The Avro Lancaster is a British four-engine World War II heavy bomber, designed and built by Avro for the Royal Air Force (RAF). It first saw active service with RAF Bomber Command in 1942 and, as the strategic bombing offensive over Europe gathered momentum, it became the main heavy bomber used by the RAF. The "Lanc", as it was affectionately known, became the most famous and most successful of the Second World War night bombers, delivering 608,612 long tons of bombs in 156,000 sorties. Designed to be used with the popular air combat game system created by Andrea Angiolino and Pier Giorgio Paglia, each WW2 Wings of Glory Special Pack is a ready-to-play large size model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW2 Wings of Glory game product. In each pack you will find all you need to play with the airplane: a special base with gaming stats, a variable altitude flying stand, and a specific deck of maneuver cards, as well as specific rules and components necessary to use the airplane. Bonus contents in this pack include one double-sided industrial complex card and special rules. This is not a complete game. To play, you must own a WW2 Rules and Accessories Pack.
183704.name: Wings of Glory: World War 2 – Avro Lancaster B Mk.III
boardgameexpansion: Wings of Glory: WW2 Rules and Accessories Pack
Wings of Glory: WW2 Starter Set
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War

183705.name: Balazoo Jungle
183705.description:
From the box front:

The 3D Balancing Animal Game. Easy to learn, exciting and quick to play and Educational too! To beat the clock, pile on the pressure, don't tip the balance. Hundreds of ways to win.

From the box rear: The first player turns over top card and the sand timer. The player then attempts to Score by performing a successful Balazoo before the timer runs out. A successful Balazoo occurs when all 5 animals are arranged in a pattern very similar to that shown on the configuration card. The player must take their hands away and the animals must freely stand.

183706.name: East Lynthorpe Farm - Summer
183706.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A small cluster of farm buildings, surrounded by snow covered fields, farmland and dirt tracks. A small bridge crosses a stream. Fields are full of crops.

Download includes:

250dpi A4 pdf, with gridded map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridless map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing (gridded and gridless)




A note on VTT use - we have deliberately kept the quality of the file high, and you may need to resize the jpeg for use in your VTT software. Keeping the file size and resolution high gives you the flexibility to use the map how you want - crop out a particular section or use the entire map, the choice is yours.

183707.name: East Lynthorpe Farm - Winter
183707.description:
From publisher blurb:

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A small cluster of farm buildings, surrounded by snow covered fields, farmland and dirt tracks. A small bridge crosses a stream. The landscape is covered with snow.

Download includes:

250dpi A4 pdf, with gridded map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi A4 pdf, with gridless map spread across 50 pages for easy printing.
250dpi full jpeg versions for VTT or poster printing (gridded and gridless)




A note on VTT use - we have deliberately kept the quality of the file high, and you may need to resize the jpeg for use in your VTT software. Keeping the file size and resolution high gives you the flexibility to use the map how you want - crop out a particular section or use the entire map, the choice is yours.

183708.name: Green in the Emperor's Eye
183708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thanks to heroic action in the arena, one of the Blues has been singled out for praise by the Emperor. Indeed, so pleased is the Emperor with this racer that an offer is made to let this Blue ride for the Greens for a race, as the Greens are currently in need of an extra pair of hands due to an injury. It is never said, but it is implied, that should the Blue run this race well, the offer may become permanent. Which would mean a spot on the team that has the favor of the Emperor. And that is a path to freedom from the arena. ...Only, racing for the Greens would mean betraying the Blues.

183709.name: 10+ Treasures: Grave Goods
183709.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fourth entry in the 10+ Treasures line features 29 magic items, including a club that ensures the undead stay dead, claws that cause you to acquire the face of everyone you kill, a ring that turns you into an actual shadow, and canopic jars that let you safely store your organs while you're still alive.

In addition to extensive notes on how we go about creating magic items (which we've included with all of our 10+ Treasures collections), we've also included five monsters (some new, some more mythologically accurate than their Dungeon World counterparts).

183710.name: Mercury and Violet
183710.description:
From publisher blurb:

He's Swift. She's Lucky.

Before they were Mercury (PL 10) and Violet (PL 10), the Niemczyk twins were just Pavel and Wioletta, Polish orphans living a harsh life of foster homes and abuse. When their Meta powers flourished, they were taken in by Polarity, the powerful master of the Meta nation group, who claimed he just wanted safety and peace for their kind. But when he was revealed to be a warmonger, Mercury and Violet used their superhuman speed and probability manipulation to assist in defeating Polarity, and have since gained a pardon in return for joining the hero group the Sentinels.

183711.name: Campaign Chunks Volume Seven
183711.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Campaign Chunk is an item, place or something else that can fit into any campaign or story with little or no modification, although some will be more suited to certain genres than others.

They have few stats and can help provide starting grounds for adventures or help fill in the gaps when your players go off exploring and you need something for them to do. Each has several hooks or rumour that can be used. Which of these are true and which are false?

Originally first published on the blog/website of Ennead Games, these Chunks have been compiled into a handy volume. Their details may have been cleaned up and more hooks or rumours added to them, but they basically the same.

Contents:

Aqua Planet - A popular aquatic animal park
Blackout - What happens when the power is cut off?
Blood Knights - A lost splinter group of the Knights Templar
Bloodthirsty White-Eared titi - A bloodthirsty little monkey
Cathsar-Sarmal Boat Race - Annual boat race between two nerby cities
Goat Refuge - A refuge for goats and more
Maketh Glass - Glass with some valuable properties
Pilot Whale - A creature with two distinct sub-species
Resurrected Caesar Cocktail - A popular drink with a kick to it
White-Cap Mushroom - A newly discovered type of fungus only found in one location

183712.name: Captain Archon
183712.description:
From publisher blurb:

No retreat, no surrender... Captain Archon!

A Power Level 11 Rival, Captain Archon is a United States Air Force captain with an unusually broad mandate. She is both research subject and Public Relations champion, in addition to her active military role fighting meta-humans at home and abroad. Captain Archon is an iconic figure in the Beacon City universe, but can be dropped into any campaign with very little alteration.

Captain Archon is a technologically enhanced superhuman whose battlesuit is powered by her own innate super-powers. Her special qualities helped her rise through the ranks, but she takes her role very, very seriously. As a result, she is uncompromising when dealing with superheroes unaffiliated with an official group, and may often come into conflict with them. A prefect Rival for heroes who like to challenge the system, she represents both patriot and defender of order. Built under the same guidelines for a Power Level 11 Player Character, she can also be used as a handy "Guest Star" for a player visiting your game who doesn't have a character ready.

183713.name: The Wushu Master (Hybrid Class)
183713.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue introduces a new hybrid class, the wushu master. Combining the martial arts of the monk with the arcane spell casting of the wizard, the wushu master's unarmed attack can really punch it up with power. Four new oriental weapons are also included as well as feats designed for the Wushu Master.

183714.name: Armed Naval Courier
183714.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a lightly armed 300 dT interstellar navy courier.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

183715.name: Breachworld Quick Start
183715.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Earth is an untamed wilderness, unrecognizable from centuries ago when humanity enjoyed a Golden Age of peace and science. A global disaster produced untold numbers of rips in space and time, collapsing society overnight. Known as Breaches, these portals into our world continue to bring monsters, aliens, and otherworldly environments to Earth. The result is an endless wilderness dotted with villages and ruins, where incredible technology exists alongside paranormal power, and the impossible is the norm.

Player Characters are farmers or warriors, adventurers or survivors. Will you seek truth, or fortune? Protect the weak or look out for yourself? Pillage or rebuild? Will you discover your potential as an Epic and bend reality to your will, or help to reclaim a world that once was? All of these possibilities, and more, are before you.

Breachworld is powered by Mini Six, part of the Open D6 family of games. With the whole ruleset included in these pages, and simple mechanics for character creation and gameplay, you can get started in just minutes.

In this Quick Start version of the RPG, get a glimpse of the complete game. This "lite" version is completely playable, with Player Races, Perks, Complications, Aether Feats, Gear, Breach Creatures and a details Place of Interest. It's fully compatible with other Mini Six games as well.

183716.name: Capitán Flint
183716.description:
After overcoming many dangers, you have finally found the treasure of Captain Flint. You'll have to calculate properly when to claim your share of the treasure since the other pirates also want their part, and you must be ready by the time Parche, Captain Flint's parrot, appears.

And all this before the ghost of the Captain arrives on the scene.

Capitán Flint is a frenzied card game for 2-6 brave and gutsy pirates. Catch the parrot Parche to find the treasure, collect as many gems and coins from it before Flint's ghost catches you, and become the richest pirate.

At the end of the game, the player who has collected more jewels from Flint's treasure wins!

183717.name: SeraQetra
183717.description:
A chess-style game using a hexagonal grid (with seven cells across each edge) and 25 custom pieces per player. Pieces may move in straight lines in up to 12 directions, either through the sides or corners of the cells, capturing pieces by landing on them. A player loses when their "God" is captured.

The game supports either two or three players, with each player starting with control of a "universe" that is the region of cells formed within the triangle of three consecutive corners of the board. In a two-player game, the universes are opposite. In a three-player game, they form a complete ring around the edge of the board.

Players may place their pieces anywhere within their universe at the start of the game (with no fixed set-up), even holding some pieces back to be placed on the board (in their universe) during play. The exceptions are the three corners, which must be empty before play begins (the central corner is termed the "throne" and the two flanking corners are the "palace gates").

The types of playing piece (with number of pieces per player listed in brackets) move as follows:

God (1): one step in any direction.
Ruler (2): unlimited steps in any direction.
Ambassador (4): unlimited steps through sides only.
Warrior (4): unlimited steps through corners only.
Priest (2): one step through sides only.
Spy (2): one step through corners only.
Minion (10): one step in any direction.




Only a God or Ruler can occupy the throne. A Minion can be substituted with a different captured piece if it reaches an opponent's palace gates (to any piece except a Ruler) or an opponent's throne (where it can be substituted for a captured Ruler).

183718.name: The Metabolism Game
183718.description:
An educational game that uses Abstracts of Sciences to assist students learning the major oxidative pathways, glycolysis and the citric acid cycle. The multicolored gameboard shows these pathways with each metabolic intermediate identified by name, structural formula and number of carbon atoms. The names of the enzymes are printed on arrows that symbolize the chemical reactions of the pathways.

The players move tokens representing carbon atoms along the pathways. A molecule of a carbon compound is symbolized by a stack of the proper number of tokens. Thus glucose would have six tokens, and 3-phosphoglyceraldehyde, three.
A deck of 70 “enzyme cards” is used to regulate the play. Each card shows a reaction present on the board with the name of the enzyme. To move a molecule from one step in a pathway to the next, a player must have in hand the appropriate enzyme card. There are three enzyme cards in the deck for each reaction on the board as well as four “wild enzyme” cards which may be used to catalyze any reaction. The game makes use of ATP “currency” of three denominations: one, three and ten ATP units. The ATP is gained or lost by a player depending on the reactions being carried out as the game proceeds. The object of the game is to gain more ATP than the other players. Oxidative phosphorylation is simulated by the use of tokens representing NADH and FADH, and special cards representing oxygen. Oxygen debt is simulated whenever a player with reducing power lacks oxygen cards.

183720.description:
Ladies and gentlemen! The biggest sporting event is about to begin, THE SNAIL RACE. All players get ready in the starting line with a clear goal: AVOID TO BE THE FIRST WHO ARRIVES TO THE FINISH LINE.

Players should use the result of the dice to move the snail figures of the other players so that their snails remains in last position at the end of the race.
183720.name: Cargolino Valentino

183721.name: Virandia Livre des Joueur
183721.description:
User summary:

The core rule book ("Player's Book") includes these major sections:

Role Playing
- What is Role Playing?
- Virandia is original
- Characterization

The Real World
- The pre-Cyberpunk world
- The world of virtual reality

The official guide to Virandia
- Politics
- Geography
- Legends
- Units and measures
- Magic
- Technology
- Peculiarities of the Virtual World

Dictionary

Appendices

183722.name: Virandia Livre du Maître
183722.description:
User summary:

The core rule book ("Judge's Book") includes these major sections:

- The secrets of Virandia
- Basics
- The Virtual World
- DerHag, AnHag, Ereknor, Baldar, Strange Countries (locales)
- Bestiary
- Advice

183723.name: Le Jour du Draconide
183723.description:
De l'Aventure:

Ciel! Seriez-vous devenu un maître de jeu magnanime? Les joueurs vont tout réussir dans ce scénario! Enfin, la première journée, pour être plus précis... Une courte aventure de deux jours pour un groupe de joueurs de taille indéterminée, qui s'apercevra bien vite qu'il ne faut jamais bâcler une enquête...

183724.name: La ballade de Tycho
183724.description:
De l'Aventure:

Ce scénario destiné à un groupe d'Alter Ego expérimentés ou non va entraîner les joueurs dans une course-poursuite à travers Virandia. Il présente la particularité de pouvoir être joué en parallèle par plusieurs groupes de joueurs.

183725.name: Un Jour au Paradis, Sans Obligation d'Achat
183725.description:
De l'Aventure:

Ce scénario permet d'introduire le monde de Virandia à un groupe de nouveaux joueurs (2 à 6 personnes). Il prévoit la création des personnages en semi-réel, la découverte du monde, des règles de base et du combat. Le scénario débute avant que les joueurs n'aient créé leur personnage.

183726.name: Le Ver de l'Amitié
183726.description:
De l'Aventure:

La ville est en émoi: cela faisait quelques temps qu'un crime aussi acharné n'avait pas eu lieu, et qui dit «crime acharné» dit aussi «punition exemplaire», ce qui peut pratiquement se traduire par «mise à mort en public», et le citoyen moyen est friand d'émotions fortes.

183727.name: Pistes de Développement de Scénarios
183727.description:
À partir du document:

La liste suivante donne un vague aperçu des éléments que l’on peut retrouver dans des scénarios de Virandia. Elle a été établie après consultation du livre de règle, et n’a d’autre but que d’aider les maîtres de jeu à développer leurs propres scénarios. Il ne s’agit que de pistes de développement. Libre à tout maître d’y puiser de l’inspiration, d’utiliser les éléments qui l’intéressent et d’exclure ceux qui lui semblent superflue.

Cette liste ne suit aucun ordre précis: les idées sont présentées en vrac. Les questions posées sont là pour éveiller l’imagination des scénaristes et c’est en fonction des réponses à ces questions que le scénario se développera.

183728.name: Living Large
183728.description:
From publisher blurb:

They were given a destiny of greatness. Even when young, they would tower over their peers, and some would grow still larger, but for what purpose? Labeled as slow and oafish, the Anteans have a society all their own, and they will find their way.

New feats, spells, divine domains, and lore all designed for antean ponies!

183729.name: Virandia Règles Avancées de Magie
183729.description:
À partir du document:

Le lancement d'un sortilège se fait habituellement par l'association d'une Rune Objet, représentant la source de l'énergie magique utilisée, et d'une Rune Verbe, symbole de la manière dont l'énergie invoquée sera manipulée. Ce type d'association recouvre la majeure partie des sorts de base qu'un magicien peut invoquer.

183730.name: Virandia Règles Avancées de Magie:  Magie Cérémoniale
183730.description:
À partir du document:

Les magiciens de Virandia sont des personnages capables d'accomplir d'incroyables prouesses grâce à la magie. Cependant, malgrès toutes les connaissances et l'expérience que pourra acquérir un magicien, il existe des limites qu'aucun d'entre eux ne pourra surpasser s'il se contente d'utiliser les énergies qu'il est capable de manipuler instantannément.

183731.name: Reth Steelarm
183731.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to 'Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules. The core format adheres to the standard non-player character (NPC) stat block most GMs are already familiar with minus the Tactics section. This makes it easier for the GM to assist with finding information and also prepares the player for the day he or she is running games! The Special Abilities section includes more detailed write-ups of feats and character abilities than a standard NPC stat block to facilitate faster play. Sources for spells, races, classes, archetypes, and prestige classes from sources other than the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook™ (PZO1110) are listed in the Sources section and can be referenced in the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game Reference Document.

At the end of this document is a sheet of character and spell tokens including a token for this character and assorted Non-Player Characters (NPCs) and spell effects. For best results, print the token page and laminate the entire sheet. Initially cut out into squares. To improve ability to move and pick up the laminated tokens, trim off the gray corners to make an octagonal shape.

Snapshot Statement

Reth is a chaotic good male half-orc with fighter (brawler) and rogue (knife master) levels who excels in stealth and melee combat with small blades.

183732.name: Astrid van Etten
183732.description:
From publisher blurb:

Oops! That six-hour marathon game session started 15 minutes ago, and you have already killed a player character (PC)! He was decapitated while being consumed in dragon fire, and his corpse fell into a sphere of annihilation. Your prediction for recovery is “not likely.” You built pre-generated characters for this campaign six months and four character levels ago! You don’t want your player to sit and read the newspaper for the next 5.75 hours. You need a comparable-level character sheet quickly.

OR… A new player has just shown up to your table willing to learn to sling dice. You found out he or she was coming thirty minutes before game time. Your regular crew of miscreants has already killed off all the spare pre-generated characters you rolled up with gleeful abandon, while cackling wildly and uttering something about “drive ‘em like you stole ‘em.” You want this first gaming experience to be fun and memorable, so you don’t want to completely wing it. You need a character sheet, right now.

Welcome to 'Instant Character! Just add a player, and go! In this product, you will discover twenty complete stat blocks for a single PC, level 1 through 20, adhering to the Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game rules.
