But what I do for friends, and what this game is about, is not that. However, I also don't want to say it isn't still a ceremony. It very much is, in its own way.

It's a ceremony in the way that buying your friend a drink at the bar to celebrate is a ceremony, or getting coffee with a friend you haven't seen in a while is a ceremony.

So this game is an attempt to capture a small ceremony I perform for friends who visit from afar. And perhaps I'm performing it for you again here by giving you this game. I'm laying the tea set out for you not as an assortment of vessels and utensils, but as a system of rules. I'm asking you to be my audience and my guests, to sit and take part in something, and in the process come away with a new experience.

User Note: a Game Chef 2015 finalist.

183860.name: XenoShyft: Onslaught – Hive Expansion
boardgameexpansion: XenoShyft: Onslaught
183860.description:
We thought we had seen the worst the Hive had to offer. From Corpse Eaters to Panic Spiders to Bile Slugs, we figured it couldn't get much worse, we were wrong.

With each day new terrors spill out from the Hive: Flesh Tick Swarms, Living Nests, Gore Maulers... juas a few of the new "species" we've encountered. We don't know what's caused it, or just how many there are, but one thing is for certain: the Hive is evolving, and it might spell doom for us all.

This Expansion Box Contains:

3x Unique Hive Boss Cards
20x Wave 1 Hive Cards
20x Wave 2 Hive Cards
20x Wave 3 Hive Cards

A copy of XenoShyft: Onslaught is required for play.

183861.name: The Long Sleep
183861.description:
From the Rulebook:

The Long Sleep is a storygame for 3-6 players. It's handy to have pencils and paper on hand when you play, but the only thing that's necessary is a deck of cards.

Each of the players takes the part of a person who has been stricken with a strange disease that has quickly spread across the globe. The disease makes people lapse into a comatose state, the "Long Sleep" of the title.

In their dreaming slumber, the Sleepers are on a journey ina strange world that is partly drawn from their own dreams, and filled with strange, splendid sights.

User Note: a Game Chef 2015 finalist.

183863.name: By the Author of "Lady Windermere's Fan"
rpg: By The Author of "Lady Windermere's Fan"
183863.description:
From the rulebook/play:

Playwright: Oh, hello there. [He stands and moves downstage.] Let me apologize for this "one-man-show" opening; it's gauche, but I felt it was important to discuss how this was going to work. This isn't really a play, you see. This is a game. A game in the genre I mostly hear called "Story Games"; table-top role-playing games built around simulating particular sorts of narrative, generally built for single sessions of a few hours, and often without a Game Master or similar figurehead.
But it's written in the form of a play. Yes, that makes this an in-character document, and yes, those can be dreadfully obnoxious, but if I didn't get an opportunity to flex my obnoxiousness from time to time I would positively burst.
[The Playwright pauses to take a mug from his desk and sip at it. He pauses a moment, savoring both his beverage and the impatience of the audience.]

User Note: This is a story game intended to create a story much like an Oscar Wilde play. A Game Chef 2014 finalist.

183864.name: 12 Labours of Hercules II: The Cretan Bull
183864.description:
The evil goddess Hera has frightened the great Cretan bull! The bull is going wild and ruining the roads and many buildings. Help Hercules save the day by taming the great Cretan Bull.

Source: The Developer Website.

183865.name: 12 Labours of Hercules III: Girl Power
183865.description:
A hero from Ancient Greece, Hercules, is fighting the great beast Scylla, when lurking Charybdis captures his friend Cerberus! Then, unseen by Hercules, takes the hero himself. The only chance for Hercules is his wife Megara. Help Megara free the hero and then accompany him in all of his adventures, including the forest of the Amazons and Mount Olympus in 12 Labours of Hercules III: Girl Power!

Source: The Developer Website.

183866.name: Kesse Rüben
183866.description: Kesse Rüben is a strategic gambling game. The cropland consists of 16 fields, were farmers can plant their own crops. However, before a crop can be planted, first another farmer should be challenged, and bet an unknown number of crops. The winner of the gambling duel can perform a number of actions, like moving to another field, planting an own crop, or removing the crop of another farmer. The farmer who ends up with the highest number of crops, wins the game.

183868.name: Awkward Turtle
183868.description:
Awkward Turtle is an adult party word game with 352 of the most awkward sounding, feeling and looking words English offers. Anything from "penis" to the seemingly benign "moist".

Two teams duke it out in 60 second rounds. The first team to guess enough words correctly to reach 30 points is crowned the "Awkward Turtle Champions"!

Basically it's a crude, adult version of taboo! Try to describe the word on the top of the card without saying the words presented on the bottom of the card!

Features 352 of the most awkward looking, sounding, and feeling words English has to offer.

183869.description:
Are you Llama enough to please your goddess? The Llama Goddess is not a sweet goddess. She likes the fight more than anyone and if you want to gain her respect, you are going to spit til the last drop of drool you have!

Command your Llama around the battlefield, spit the others, gain goddess favor points and try to look clean in order to achieve the higher score!

Llama Fight is a board game for 2-4 players in which you command a Llama with cards. You have 3 different actions: Spit, Move and take towels for later cleaning. Combine them with values and make those actions X times. Everytime you spit, you gain favor goddess points. Two rounds later, the cleanest and devoutest Llama wins the match.
183869.name: Llama Fight!

183871.description:
The Icarus Project is a fast paced, narrative driven, sci fi skirmish wargame set over 700 years in the future. Players take control of small groups of elite soldiers, called strike forces, as they try to accomplish a variety of missions including assassinations, prisoner captures, and bomb disposals.

With a focus on narrative, cinematic gameplay, the Icarus Project is a game filled with water-cooler moments that will have you and your friends re-telling the stories for years to come.

Take control of the Galactic Alliance of Humanity, a utilitarian behemoth with the largest military in the galaxy, or command the Nexus, a brutal alien race that wants nothing more than to wipe humanity from the galactic stage.

With a variety of other factions and races, the Icarus Project has something for everyone. The Praesidians are a wise and noble race, and posses some of the most advanced technology in existence. The Ji'tar are iron-willed and don't take kindly to outsiders. And the Mercenary faction allows you to take control of the galaxy's criminals, outlaws, and guns for hire that can be added to any other strike force.
183871.name: The Icarus Project
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 67: Sunday, September 18th

183872.name: Twinz
183872.description:
From the publisher:

Working with the player next to you, try to make the other players guess the mystery word! 5, 4, 3, 2, 1 ... Say your clue at the same time as your partner! But be careful: it MUST be different, otherwise you'll lose points! So you'll have to be relevant while remaining original to score the maximum number of points.

183874.name: Balloon Challenge
183874.description:
Try to blow up the balloon perfectly! Baaaan!

Let's fly the balloons in the sky!
The prince say that. The people tries to blow up a ballon, but sometimes break it, and sometimes it is not enough, still be small.
However the people continues to blow up the balloons! The prince also try to blow up a ballon. Because, in his eyes, the people enjoys very well.

Until the colorful balloons decorate the sky, it is a little more at that time !

The players have 5 and more cards with the numbers in the hand.
The turn player can play one card in the table, or drop from the round.
When all players drop the round, now scoring. The number of the played cards is the balloon size. The sum of the remained cards in the hand is the number of blowing up a balloon.

For example, the 8 cards are played on the table. The cards in the hand are the three cards with 0, 2 and 4. The size is 8, and the number of blowing up is 6 (0 + 2 + 4). It is not full!
The scoring is 6 points.
In the game, we have the simple bonus points with the fish discs. But it is not small points.

After the fifth round, the winner is the highest player!

183875.name: Iconic Encounters: Kobold Lair
183875.description:
From publisher blurb:

Iconic Encounters is a series of adventure sites that feature monsters and tropes we've known throughout the years. They are written to be easy to pick up and use immediately. They are stripped of setting or plot restrictions (though adventure ideas are provided) and are designed to fit seamlessly into your own campaign.

Kobold Lair features the crafty little monsters and their traps. It includes 7 traps, most brand new, and a complete lair with easy-to-use stats (for levels 1-3). Eight adventure ideas have been provided in case you don't have one of your own. While written for 5E it can be readily used for any edition of D&D.

183876.name: Blood & Bone: Undead Characters for OSR Games
183876.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood & Bone introduces new racial character classes for use with Labyrinth Lord... and all of them are undead. Play as a ghoul, juju zombie, mummy, skeleton, spectre, vampire, wight, wraith or zombie, and teach the living to fear the dead!

Blood & Bone is written for Labyrinth Lord and compatible with other old-school fantasy role-playing games.

183877.description:
The Fool's Journey is a tarot-based storytelling game, in which a "journey" of nine cards is constructed collaboratively by the players. Bidding (using the non-trump suits) allows players to compete for the prerogative of decisions about trump placement, and to be awarded dice.

All players are encouraged to provide their own unique narrative interpretations of the journey at the end of the game. Dice won earlier in the game are rolled to determine priority for who gets to tell a story first.

The game requires a copy of the rules, a standard 78-card tarot deck, and "a large pool of six-sided dice (Generally a box of 36 will do)." Pencil and paper are also suggested.
183877.name: The Fool's Journey
boardgamepodcastepisode: 128. Fool’s Journey/Tanya DePasse

183878.name: Strange Magic Items: Truenaming
183878.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Strange Magic Items series splits a full codex of magic items into the three subsystems laid out in Strange Magic: ethermagic, truename magic, and musical composition. Each of these thirds has its own unique flavor, both in fluff and in terms of mechanics, and such compartmentalization allows those who only bought some of the constituent thirds of Strange Magic to pick up whatever new content interests them.

Truename magic is all about deliberation, poise, and explicit intent. For a truenamer to attempt to recite something before its exact phrasing is known is little better than suicide. Necessarily, a truenamer's experimentation takes no chances. The ultimate end goal of First Language experimentation is not new recitations, but rather to get the universe to heed those recitations permanently. Since a recitation must be known to the most exacting degree to have any hope of influencing the universe permanently, truename magic items are among the most deliberately-made objects in the known cosmos. Chaos and uncertainty simply do not exist in the realm of the truenamer, and the seemingly-chaotic creations of a scion of discordia are, in actuality, the painstakingly-researched masterpieces of a rhetorician who knows exactly how to make her audience react however she wants.

Of course, it's not fair to assume that truename magic items are dull, wooden, and utilitarian simply because the research to make one that doesn't spontaneously explode is meticulous. There's just something about building something ridiculous out of universal constants that draws a very specific sort of personality, and truenamers have been one-upping each others' whimsy pieces for centuries. Whenever a tower shield transforms into a tower with a periscope, that's a truenamer's work. Whenever a club insults its target constantly, that's a truenamer's work. Whenever something that couldn't possibly come stocked with a minibar has a minibar anyway, that's a truenamer's work. Whenever a random ring, amulet, or tiara finds a way to make its creator's intellectual superiority known mere moments before atomizing its target, that's DEFINITELY a truenamer's work.

Contents

9 armor/weapon/shield special abilities
3 specific magic weapons, including songbird - a dagger that turns enhancement bonus into a spellcasting minigame
3 specific tower shields, including the portable watchtower - a shield that takes the hits and dishes them out so you don't have to!
a new kind of wand
12 magic items with 11 additional variants, including the overlord's dogtag - a necklace that can turn just about any outsider into a bonded servant




To get full use out of this product, Strange Magic or Ultimate Truenaming is required.

183879.name: Traitor
183879.description:
Traitor is a 2-player abstract strategy game. It is played with 10 wooden pawns per side on a wooden board.

Pawns move one square forward or sideways, and capture diagonally. The goal of the game is simply to land one of your pawns on your opponent's back line.

A pawn is chosen at random to be the Traitor. At a specific point in the game, the Traitor is revealed, and it changes allegiance. Your opponent's pawn becomes your pawn to control. But one of your pawns may still be a Traitor, waiting for the perfect time to reveal itself...

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
183880.description:
This Risk: Star Wars Edition game lets players re-create the dramatic final moments of Star Wars: Return of the Jedi. Featuring gameplay for 2 or 4 players across a TIE fighter-shaped gameboard, players can determine the fate of the Star Wars universe through 3 concurrent (yet distinct) battles. Choose to play as either the Rebel Alliance or the Galactic Empire, and use the classic Risk dice to control characters and ships. The object of the game is to defend or destroy the Death Star. Which side will win: the Galactic Empire or the Rebel Alliance?

Rules Clarification
183880.name: Risk: Star Wars Edition
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 88 - If You Like Dead of Winter, Try...
Bruges - Episode 026
Ep 33 STAR WARS with Alex Eding
Episode 2 - A-B-C, 1-2-3
Episode 2 - Star Wars Special And Imperial Assault Review
Episode 7 - Ding & Dent's Holiday Gift Guide!
GrogCast Season 3, Episode Quatr-oh!
I've Been Diced! episode 71: Mutants, game studies, and 2015 in review
MN 0117 Even More Two Player Games
RDTN Episode 77 – Fortress Around Your Heart: A visit from the Podfather – Stephen Buonocore, Game Day with Pete and Scott
RDTN Episode 81 – Come Together: BGG Con Review – Suzanne Sheldon, Matt Evans, Chaz Marler, and Joel Eddy
Star Wars special
The Dice Steeple - Episode 13 - Hilarity in Gaming - What's Your Punchline?
The Good, The Board and the Redone: Episode 49 “2nd Editions”

183881.name: Goblin Dice
183881.description:
Put yourself in the goblin runner's shoes and take part in a fun and exciting race. Only good reaction and agile mind will help you survive this dangerous race, because a huge Magic Stone is rushing at your heels and will flatten anyone who gets in its way! Roll the dice to earn bonus points and become the fastest on the race track!

Goblin Dice consists of a random number of rounds and continues until one of the players reaches the finish line – he is considered the winner — or the stone flattens everyone except one player, with this final survivor being the winner.

Every round each player rolls two dice and uses any two of them to move or to activate the tile's special feature. Once all of the players have used their dice, the stone behind them moves and tries to smash the last runners. Players do not only move their goblins forward, but they can also activate special features of the tiles, complicating the game for their opponents.

183882.name: Gygax Magazine (Issue 6 - Sep 2015)
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
183882.description:
Gygax Magazine
Issue #6
Volume I, No. 6

Pulp Era - the complete RPG
Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
Dracovalis: A board game of conquest and defense

183883.description:
In the economic game Port of Piraeus, you are one of many prudent and provident merchants who have come to the Port of Piraeus from all over the world to sell their goods and purchase overseas items. Every decision you make will inevitably influence the market and either simplify or complicate the game for your opponents. Act carefully, trade proficiently and become the most successful merchant in the Port of Piraeus!

Players become merchants from different countries who are trying to make money buying and selling different commodities. There are eight trading days in the game, and each day players get to choose whether they want to buy other merchants’ products or sell their own. The prices for different products will keep changing depending on the situation. When they arrive back home, each merchant will get a good price for all the goods they buy here!

The player who earns more money by the end of the game becomes the winner.
183883.name: Port of Piraeus
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 74- Antarctica

183884.name: Afro Samurai 2: Revenge of Kuma - Volume 1
183884.description:
User Summary

Afro Samurai was originally a Japanese manga created by Takashi Okazaki. The story centered around Afro Samurai. As a young child he witnesses his father's murder over the #1 headband - believed to give the wearer super powers.

This is the first entry in a trilogy.

183885.name: Afro Samurai 2: Revenge of Kuma - Volume 2
183885.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Afro Samurai was originally a Japanese manga created by Takashi Okazaki. The story centered around Afro Samurai. As a young child he witnesses his father's murder over the #1 headband - believed to give the wearer super powers.

This is the second entry in a trilogy.

183886.name: Afro Samurai 2: Revenge of Kuma - Volume 3
183886.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development. Please only submit images if you own a copy or have legal access to this item.




User Summary

Afro Samurai was originally a Japanese manga created by Takashi Okazaki. The story centered around Afro Samurai. As a young child he witnesses his father's murder over the #1 headband - believed to give the wearer super powers.

This is the third entry in a trilogy.

183887.description:
From the publisher's rulebook:

At the beginning of the Fifteenth Century, "the Age of Discovery" was beginning from Portugal. In Lisbon, the merchants have big dreams. They try to get their big chance as a trader with West Africa. In this time, Europeans didn't know about the Americas, they had just started to trade with West Africa. But in Portugal, the "Dinastia de Avis" supported their merchants for the new area.

Players are merchants. They try to gain inﬂuence with the Kings "Joan I", "Duarte I", "Pedro" and "Henrique". The players bring the requested goods from West Africa, Madeira and Azores to the Kings. And they also add crews, get support from others, and collect income in “Reals”.

Each player gets resources by putting their own Crew chips on the West Africa boards. By developing the areas, players offer the goods sought by the Kings. In return, they gain Ships and Adventurers to help them. Players also advance their Nobles along the Lisbon track, building Markets, and collecting Crew. Players also get Support Cards in return for Gold.

Each King will pay out Reals to the best merchants. When all the Kings have paid income, the game ends and players collect a final income and bonuses. The richest player is the winner. Try to be the best merchant in Portugal!
183887.name: Lisbon, The Gate to the World

183888.name: Star Wars Death Star Boom Boom Balloon
183888.description:
It's Star Wars Death Star Boom Boom Balloon, the crazy and unpredictable game where at any time the balloon can go BOOM! In this Star Wars Edition, it's a race to destroy the Death Star. Players take turns attacking the Death Star, but no one knows when it will go BOOM! Roll the die, and carefully push in a stick until it clicks. Squeeze and stretch the Death Star - will the next click make it pop? Be the leader with the most X-wing Starfighters in play to win! Bring home the thrill of Boom Boom Balloon - Star Wars Edition!
Star Wars Death Star Boom Boom Balloon is the crazy game where each player tries to keep the balloon from popping!

Basic Idea is the same as Boom Boom Balloon but with a Star Wars Twist

•Roll the die and "click" a Laser stick for each number rolled. Will the Death Star explode? Watch out!

•It's a race to destroy the Death Star! BOOM! Will your Rebel Alliance fleet be the largest when it pops?

•Star Wars Boom Boom Balloon is made for 2-6 players ages 8 and up. No Batteries Required

•Includes: 1 Balloon Frame, 18 X-Wing Starfighters, 12 Death Star Balloons, 1 Die, 9 Laser Sticks, 1 Instruction Sheet, Batteries Not Required

183889.name: Wings
183889.description:
From the rulebook:

The Pitch: This is a game for 3-5 players about fairies who ride dragonflies but it’s also about teenagers and their evolving relationships with their parents or guardians. In this game, you will play fairies that are completely dependent on the dragonflies they ride for everything while the dragonflies have an inherent fear of this relationship changing. During the game, the fairies will be given opportunities to explore their own independence or to continue their dependence on their dragonfly guardians.

183891.name: Laserlife
183891.description:
Do our memories die with us, or do they live on somewhere, waiting to be discovered?

Somewhere in the cosmos, the body of a long dead astronaut floats alone through space. A strange presence with the power to rebuild memories and relive lives attempts to stitch together a human’s past.

Source: The Developer Website.

183893.name: Contempt for the Ogre-Poet
183893.description:
From the Rulebook:
There is no book in the fiefdom, not since the ogre-poet came.

For nigh on eight years, the ogre-poet has terrorised the wildfolk of the realm, feasting on their flesh when e’er he finds them. The only safety was found in literature: the ogre-poet would wander off, distracted by the book and forgetting his hunger for the month.

In three days’ time, the sickle moon is set to rise and the ogre-poet will again venture out on his fleshfeast.

You have three days to stop him

User Note: a Game Chef 2014 finalist

183894.name: Degenerate Semantics
183894.description:
From the Wiki Page:

Degenerate Semantics is a role-playing game for 1-5 players and one Game Master (GM). The players will each portray a character who live in Emmaloopen's poverty-stricken lower city. They are young, wild, ambitious, and independent. This way of life is threatened by other factions, and the players will need to have their characters work together to survive and thrive.

In the process of playing the game, the players and GM will define and flesh out a language called Bandethal. A collection of street terms and slang, Bandethal is used both as a way to talk openly about illicit activities without alerting authorities and to establish street cred. The terms are liberally mixed in with plain English, or when the language is mature enough, can be used entirely on its own. The characters' success is in large part based on how proficiently the players wield the language.

User Note: a Game Chef 2014 finalist

183895.name: Palm and Pine
183895.description:
From the rules cards:

Palm and Pine is a roleplaying game in which the rules change in every scene. In this game, a group of people are travelling through the overgrown ruins of a long dead civilization and stop to tell their myths and stories about those who dwelled there. While the vast majority of play takes place in that mythic historical context, each player should name and have a basic idea of their character in that framing sequence before play begins.

User Note: a Game Chef 2014 finalist.

183896.description:
Join Mal, Wash, Zoë, Inara, Kaylee, Jayne, Simon, River, Book, and more as Fluxx enters the 'Verse at full speed. With the rules constantly changing, Firefly Fluxx is just as unpredictable as misbehaving in space!

Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game. There are many editions, themed siblings, and promo cards available.
183896.name: Firefly Fluxx
boardgameexpansion: Firefly Fluxx: Saffron
Fluxx Promo Cards
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 016 – Quadropolis vs Suburbia
Episode 3 - Scare Tactics
The Polyhedron Collider Cast Episode 8

183897.name: The Stuff of Dreams and Nightmares
rpg: The Stuff of Dreams and Nightmares
183897.description:
From the rulebook:

The Wildlings have invaded your dream!
Will it make you laugh or make you scream?
The Stuff of Dreams and Nightmares help fight or flight
Until half the Star Maps have tapped their light.
When a “Question” is posed, more Stuff you may win
Or else be lost in dream when your Star goes dim.
~ . ~
Welcome to The Stuff of Dreams and Nightmares, a story-telling,
role-playing game where you and your friends play both yourselves
and the strange creatures called Wildlings. Will the Wildlings use
the powers of the stars to absorb all the Stuff of Dreams, or will you
be able to take control of the dream, and escape?
The Wildling rhyme helps explain how to play the game in general,
but especially for the first time through, I’ll break down each line of
the rhyme to explain in more detail.
Also, the story is built by some materials you’ll have to gather.
First, each Player will need one five-ounce can of kids’ modeling
compound. This will be the “Stuff of Dreams and Nightmares”
referenced in the game. You can try for a brand name product
like Play-Doh®, a home-made version of such, or another kind of
compound like clay, as long as everyone has an equivalent amount,
about 5 ounces (about 2/3 US cup.)
Next, you’ll also need the Star Maps and the map of the Dreamscape.
You’ll see how they are used during the play, but once you are really
good at the game, or are an experienced story-gamer already, you
might even choose to make these maps optional.
Finally, you’ll need to two coins. Any pair will do, as long as each
coin has a discernible head/tail side.

183898.name: The Three and the Wheel
183898.description:
From the rules:

You are the Great Spirits, immortal makers of the world.
You take three forms that drive its existence, one in each role:
The Wild Prince, horned and beautiful
The Queen of Light, glittering and majestic
The Iron Sickle, stark and unrelenting
Together, you will tell the story of the world, from its creation to its destruction.

User Note: a Game Chef 2014 finalist.

183899.description:
"Once in the lifetime of a system a brilliant enthusiastic comes along and has the talent .. and the ear ... to hear what his fellow hobbyists want in a system. The heart to make it happen. And the work ethic to stay the course. Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) has been blessed with multiple talents, the enduring skills of Drew Dorman, the affable and intelligent 'ATS Guy', Michal Blazejczyk of Virtual ATS, and others. But there is only one EAGLE. And has landed his impressive intellect ... right into the heart of the system. What's more, his efforts were to clarify -- make better -- while keeping it all STABLE as the system enters it's 'baker's dozen year'—with a 12 year run already in the rear-view mirror.

Critical Hit, Inc.'s plan is to return Scott's goodwill to each and every ATSer. A ton of work went into the new edition, and an ATS system relaunch is the result with DOZENS of never published ATS battlefields in the ready room."


A complete 74 page COLOR system rules set, 3-hole punched format. The new rules supersede all previous editions and will be the only version available.

Includes all new EXPANDED INDEX. All examples of play in COLOR.

Three versions available:

Front and Back color covers in a Binder
Non-binder version, to save international customers on postage
PDF version




(While available, a free copy of the fully searchable E RULEBOOK will be sent to those who order printed versions of the rules)

Also includes:

2 ten sided dice in various colors (not included in the No-Binder and pdf versions)





Two new 2-sided 11" × 17" folding System Play Aids (3-hole punched and shipped in the rules binder with the binder version)
183899.name: ATS Rulebook 2014
boardgameexpansion: Advanced Tobruk 2016
ATS Gallabat: The War in East Africa 1940
ATS King Red + Operation Deadstick

183900.name: Crabs in a Crate
183900.description:
Crabs are the perfect example of what a team should never be. When one is placed in an open crate, it quickly scuttles out. But when multiples are placed in a crate all the other crabs will never let the one escape in their own attempt to climb free.

Crabs in a Crate enjoys the fun hearted frustration of exactly that situation. Trying to be the ONE to escape when there is more than just you in the crate. Players will do their best to help their crab escape by playing cards that let them push, pull, piggyback and climb their way out of the crate. "Why not play nice and just race to the top?" one might ask. Escaping isn't the only way to win, if you are the crab to gain the most points by pulling down their opponents you can win!
Game can handle 3-6 players in a thirty-ish minute game.

183901.name: Precious: La cosa più preziosa
183901.description:
From the publisher website:
Gioco educativo sulla pena di morte
Precious è lo strumento che ci da la possibilità di entrare direttamente nei panni di un condannato a morte, un attivista ma anche un sostenitore della pena di morte attraverso un meccanismo ben studiato e corredato di molte informazioni, spunti di riflessione e descrizione di casi. L’abolizione della pena di morte passa per tante vie e si avvale di tanti strumenti. Precious è una di questi.

English translation:
Educational game on the death penalty
Precious is the tool that gives us the opportunity to enter directly into the shoes of a person sentenced to death, an activist but also a supporter of the death penalty through a mechanism that is well designed and equipped with a lot of information, insights and descriptions of cases.
The abolition of the death penalty goes in so many ways and uses many tools. Precious is one of these.

183902.name: Pointman Hacker Thief Core Rulebook
183902.description:
(Publisher's Blurb)
Pointman Hacker Thief is a quick, lightweight roleplaying game that allows a group of players and a game master to participate in epic espionage missions spanning the entire globe, from Hong Kong to New York City. This book has everything you need: A complete game system, including character creation, combat, hacking, equipment and NPCs, as well as a multiple modern spy settings.

Combat in the world of PHT is quick and brutal, as it is in real life. But, as they say, if you’ve been spotted, perhaps you deserve to be gunned down; you are a spy, after all.

PHT doesn’t make use of classes, like in other RPGs. Players are encouraged to create their characters freely without having to fit them into archetypal roles. Pointman, Hacker and Thief are the character’s basic attributes, which measure their capabilities in combat, academics and stealth, respectively.

A game more than 6 years in the making, Pointman Hacker Thief is the perfect lightweight modern RPG.

183903.name: Wasteland Container Fort
183903.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 269th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a fortification, built from shipping containers, across a road through the wasteland.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 4032x4320 pixels in size at 144dpi.

183904.name: Giochi d'Amore
183904.description:
From the back of the book:
Tre emozionanti giochi su passioni, relazioni e sentimenti
Giochi d’Amore contiene tre emozionanti giochi completi di Emily Care Boss, celebrata designer e teorica. L’emozione dei primi appuntamenti, la ferocia della competizione per l’amato, la complessità della gestione di una relazione... Avrete il coraggio e la passione necessari a mettervi in gioco ed esplorare questi sentimenti?

English translation:
Three exciting games of passions, relationships and feelings
Games of Love contains three exciting games designed by Emily Care Boss, celebrated designer and theorist. The excitement of the first meetings, the ferocity of the competition for the beloved, the complexity of managing a relationship ... You will have the courage and the passion needed to get involved and explore these feelings?

183905.name: Star Mini
183905.description:
From the publisher website:
In Star Mini vagherete nella vastità dello spazio scoprendo che esistono numerosi sistemi planetari abitati, collegati tra loro da un'antica storia e da una fitta rete di tunnel spaziali che consentono alle astronavi di viaggiare di mondo in mondo solo recentemente "riscoperta" e resa quindi nuovamente fruibile da tutti.

English translation:
In Star Mini you will wander in the vastness of space finfing many inhabited planetary systems, linked by an ancient history and a dense network of wormholes only recently "rediscovered" and then made again enjoyed by all that allow ships to travel from world to world .

183906.name: The Computer Takeover
183906.description:
From publisher blurb:

A renegade super computer thinks it's time HE gave the orders. As the world's top computer genius, the reader is the only hope to escape the computer's power.

183907.name: Possessed!
183907.description:
From publisher blurb:

It happens late at night, the invasion of your body and mind. When two sinister spirits from your past lives possess you, you learn of a family curse that has wrought havoc through the centuries. Only you can put an end to the evil--by breaking free of the spirits' deadly spell. A hall of haunted heads may hold the way out. But do you follow?

183908.name: Shadow of the Swastika
183908.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vienna, 1938. Nazi mobs are storming the streets. Safety lies across the border. The people of Vienna are depending on you. Can you save them?

183909.name: Fright Night
183909.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are at the grand opening of Daredevil Park's most frightening attractions. Not only are they frightening they're deadly. Is the price of admission worth your life?

183910.name: Snowboard Racer
183910.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your rippin' snowboarding style has won you a spot on your school's racing team. The insanely cut courses and hellacious half-pipes are tough enough. But when a mysterious "slope rat" plots to put you out of action--permanently--the danger gets even steeper. Snowboarding terms included.

183911.name: Master of Aikido
183911.description:
From publisher blurb:

High-jacked at gunpoint. Forced to land on a jungle island. You stand with your fellow passengers waiting to make your move. A squadron of desperate freedom fighters armed with machetes surrounds you. Beyond them lie the terrors of the jungle. But what you are least prepared to face is the story of their cause.

183912.name: Hostage!
183912.description:
From publisher blurb:

A cold fear grips the nation. An infamous drug cartel has penetrated the nation's capital and is threatening to release a deadly virus. They've taken you and your classmates hostage. You have been chosen as a go-between and must deliver their demands to the White House--or take things into your own hands and save the day.

183914.name: Greed, Guns, and Gold
183914.description:
From publisher blurb:

What's all this you hear about a deadly curse--men who have died searching for the gold of the pirate ship, Bonaparte? You hold the clues to the sandy grave of a fortune in gold and jewels. Do you dare? Think carefully before you choose--pirates aren't just history, you know.

183915.description:
An exclusive Mercenary characters pack available only to Rum & Bones Kickstarter backers. Includes 5 miniatures and hero cards.

Included heroes: Captain Blackbeard, Mister Cuddles (Swashbuckler), Handsome Jack (Quartermaster), Dudley the Duelist (Gunner), and Leopold, the Cleaver of Cordova (Brute).
183915.name: Rum & Bones: Mercenaries Promos Set #1
boardgameexpansion: Rum & Bones

183917.description:
Exclusive set of heroes for Rum & Bones Kickstarter backers. Contains 3 minatures & hero cards.

Included heroes: Captain Hook, Ahab the Vengeful (Gunner), and Peter Pan (Quartermaster).
183917.name: Rum & Bones: Mercenaries Promos Set #2
boardgameexpansion: Rum & Bones

183918.description:
Contains 3 Mercenary minatures and hero cards to expand Rum & Bones.

Included heroes: "Bossman" Kastel (Gunner), Don Quixote (Brute), and Lord Nelson (Swashbuckler).
183918.name: Rum & Bones: Mercenaries Heroes Set #2
boardgameexpansion: Rum & Bones

183919.description:
Exclusive set of Bone Devils heroes for Rum & Bones Kickstarter backers. Contains 3 minatures & hero cards.

Included heroes: Mister Smith (Gunner), Eric the Dead (Brute), and Meirenyu the Pale Syren (Gunner).

Meirenyu comes with two hero card versions. She can be played as either a Mercenary or as part of the Mazu's Dreadful Curse's crew.
183919.name: Rum & Bones: Bone Devils Mix
boardgameexpansion: Rum & Bones
Rum & Bones: Mazu's Dreadful Curse

183920.description:
Exclusive set of Wellsport Brotherhood heroes for Rum & Bones Kickstarter backers. Contains 3 minatures & hero cards.

Included heroes: Slevin the Lucky (Swashbuckler), "Not so Noble" Baston Duchampe (Brute), and Cochon Bombardier (Gunner).

Cochon comes with two hero card versions. He can be played as either a Mercenary or as part of the La Brise Sanguine's crew.
183920.name: Rum & Bones: Wellsport Brotherhood Mix
boardgameexpansion: Rum & Bones
Rum & Bones: La Brise Sanguine

183921.description:
Exclusive set of Mercenary heroes for Rum & Bones Kickstarter backers. Contains 5 minatures & hero cards.

Included heroes: Captain Napoleon, Thunder Lars (Brute), Alex of Pain (Gunner), The Killmaster (Quartermaster), and The Slasher (Swashbuckler).
183921.name: Rum & Bones: Helrokkers
boardgameexpansion: Rum & Bones

183922.name: The Last Shrine of Kyuss
183922.description:
Designer's Summary:

The Last Shrine of Kyuss is another offering of not very much used creatures from the Fiend Folio. In this case, The Sons of Kyuss. I've never ran across these guys before and Si made a suggestion for them. These guys are very nasty. So if you dislike your party immensely throw a small horde of Sons of Kyuss at them.

This one has a plot hook that has nothing to do with what is actually going on. The twist can be discovered or it can simply be a hunt and grab session. However, if the party ignores what they have found, traveling in the area become more difficult as the Sons of Kyuss make frequent appearances. And should Kyuss himself rise from his tome and unleash his waiting army, things are going to get very bad, very quick.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

183923.name: Shadow of the Executioner
183923.description:
Designer's Summary:

Shadow of the Executioner is those tweener projects. Meaning, it can easily fit under my micro-adventure or micro-location categories. It present the setting and a situation then it is up to the GM to decide how to get the antagonist involved. I like these type of free ranged adventures. You don't have creatures stapled into a room waiting around.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

183924.name: Denizon's Folly
183924.description:
Designer's Summary:

In Denizon's Folly their is a Ring of Sage that transport those who have accepted the fey's gift of fruit. But what was cut is the sage plants can be harvested then dried and ground into a powder. Sage is an essential ingredient in the creation of Sleep spells and especially potions. One plant is enough to create one potion or scroll.

Also in the adventure there is a chance the party may meet a trickster. Tricksters are considered holy within the fey community because they are entertaining and bring gifts. The trickster loves to find trinkets and hide them among the forest for others to find. A Easter egg hunt if you will. Because of this, any harm that comes to a trickster at the hands of a character will suffer the fey's wrath. Literally. More on that in the next micro-adventure

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

183925.name: It's a Trap!
183925.description:
Designer's Summary:

This is not the continuation of Denizon's Folly. That one is still in the works. It's a Trap! is a encounter adventure where you will meet a troll named Kent who has a particular fondness for sheep, but not in the bad way. And also included is a a god that would have been suitable for Petty Gods.

This adventure has a couple of Easter Eggs for one of my patrons out there. I'm curious to see if that patron discovers them.

The map for this adventure was also a bit of an experiment. I use white notecards to draw my maps on. This time I used a beige colored notecard to see how it would interact with the colors. It is a bit clumsy, but I can see how it would be effective in a badlands, scrub, wasteland type of areas. I'll have to experiment more with them.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

183926.name: The Bastard Baron's Hideaway
183926.description:
Designer's Summary:

Let me start off by saying something bad about this adventure. I don't think this adventure fully captures the Bastard Baron, Nazar. I see him as a mid-level foe that the players have heard about for a while. Has seen the results of the Bastard Baron's efforts and has had direct experience with one of more of his men. The Bastard Baron with his self-righteous beliefs makes for a fun enemy to have the players go against from time to time. While I don't think he stands up as a long term foe he definitely could be the transition from low level adventuring to mid-level adventuring.

At the end, there is a map and a key, a title to a mountain tower. This could easily be turned into a party's stronghold. Of course, someone may already be living in the tower, but I am sure that could be remedied.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

183927.name: Crypt of Sir Reginald
183927.description:
Designer's Summary:

So what we have here is an old school style of a dungeon crawl. Simple and short, but one of at least three I have planned for this series. There is something about a graph grid, some ninety degree angle rooms and corridors that make me salivate.

I kept this one as honest as I could with old time adventures I would have written back when I was in high school without having Tiamat in the third room and a small army of ghouls in the room connecting. Those were the grand old days.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

183928.name: The Pillars of Pelagia
183928.description:
From the back cover:

A Level 3 Adventure

Fifth Edition Fantasy is here! This adventure module is fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world's first fantasy RPG, and ready to play in your home campaign!

Along the windswept sea coast are several natural stone columns, sacred to the Sea Goddess Pelagia. One of these pillars is the tower of a reclusive wizard, a devout follower of Pelagia. But the wizard has gone missing, and the locals suspect foul play. Surely a powerful wizard must have many enemies!

A band of fledgling heroes is tasked with entering one of the Pillars of Pelagia to contend with all manner of magical defenses, while uncovering cryptic clues to the wizard's disappearance planted by an unknown benefactor. The insidious evil plot they uncover could spell eventual doom for the surface world. But the Pillars are sacred to Pelagia, and the Sea Goddess herself might just play a minor role, aiding the heroes as they attempt to thwart a nefarious plot.

183929.name: War-lock
183929.description:
From the back cover:

A Level 5 Adventure

Fifth Edition Fantasy is here! This adventure module is fully compatible with the fifth edition of the world's first fantasy RPG, and ready to play in your home campaign!

Devilish sorcery and ancient steel merge in the form of a reborn menace rising in the wild hills on civilization's verge. As the badlands burn with wildfire, an arcane warlord gathers his monstrous troops under his tattered banner. He is rumored to be immortal, and it will take tremendous bravery, immense cunning, and more than a little luck for stalwart adventurers to end his campaign of malice. Can your mighty heroes locate the War-lock's one weakness before his forces drown the realm in blood and fire?

183930.name: The Dirt Collector
183930.description:
Designer's Summary:

Here is another offering to you good folks. The Dirt Collector is the continuation of Sir Reginald's Crypt. It's a micro-mega-dungeon. heh. I have at least three more levels planned for it. In this adventure I introduce dirt from the four corner of the world. Each has its own special properties. I may do a larger write up about them soon. I like the idea of dwarves snorting dirt to help them find precious ore and gems. And I can image a few people would find the gray dirt interesting to build a golem.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

183931.name: Village of Osmolt
183931.description:
Designer's Summary:

The sequel to Denizon's Folly is finally here. The Village of Osmolt takes the party into a small section of the fey realm that is being assaulted by an encroaching mist. One day Blasfeemus Tower appeared and a red cap demanded sacrifices or he would summon the mists over the cliff and consume the forest. Osmolt, the leader of the village, concocted the the way to lure people into his realm so he could offer them as a sacrifice instead of his own people.

Heartless bastard.

Within this adventure there are random tables to create a time and space effect to keep the party guessing. The fey are creatures that don't abide by laws within the 4-dimensional world. Also a table to determine the fickleness of the fey the party encounters. It will be none too easy to save the children. But saved they must.

But like all Grimm Fairy Tales, they never end happily ever after.

User Summary:

A Micro Adventure, published by Tim Shorts on his Patreon page.

183932.name: Hunters Crossing
183932.description:
Designer's Summary:

Hunter Crossing is my third and final entry into August 2015. It is a micro-location. A place to put between places or out of the way places. I borrowed heavily (or stole, but let's not get too picky) from Spartacus for this one. You could say this is the House of Batiatus after Spartacus revolted. Then toss in some fantasy elements and you've got Hunters Crossing.

This entire offering was borrowed upon, borrow of things. One of my favorite TV shows of all-time is Robin of Sherwood. In that show it had these Wayland's Seven Swords of Power. Well, if your players are lucky ( or not so lucky) they'll find one of these swords.

In Hunters Crossing you'll find four new creatures, one new flower and four unique magic items. I color coded them, blue for the monsters, green for the herbal stuff and yellow for the magic items.

User summary:

A Micro Location published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

183933.name: Echo Patrol
183933.description:
Designer's Summary:

I finally did it. I wrote a sci-fi adventure. Echo Patrol is a straight forward adventure, but I had a lot of fun changing up the genre. I've been toying with the idea of doing a sci-fi micro-adventure since I first created my Patreon. I plan to sprinkle in more now that I've broke the Martian ice. And I've finally bought a few of the systems so I can get some ideas. Just need to read them now.

One of the things I added into Echo Patrol was the mission objective. More of a military or company set of goals they want to achieve. The other thing I added is salvage. One of my favorite things in futuristic games is scavenging for parts hoping to make something useful. You'll find various objects assigned a salvage value. Make of them what you will. I'm open for suggestions. It's a system I would like to develop.

User summary:

A Micro Adventure published on Tim Shorts's Patreon page.

183934.name: Last 2 Standing
183934.description:
This is the ultimate party game of revealing truths. This racy game provides instant fun for 6 to 20 players in the most stimulating, thought-provoking, hilarious, intriguing, invasive, exciting way ever! This game will eliminate attractiveness while heightening the likability of the players. Whether you are married, single, dating, in-between, just kicking with friends, straight, LGBT, or Green... this game is for you. Dating will never be any easier after playing the Last 2 Standing!
It's simple! Remain standing in the game by answering a series of intuitive unisex questions that will certainly put you at the edge of your seat with a lot of "Ah-Ha" moments, and you will be crowned as a winner. Choose a moderator. Split into sides (i.e Men vs Women). Get a token. Place the tokens on the board. Roll the die. Select a card from 1 of the 6 decks. Read the question aloud to the opposite team. Start the 30 second timer. Answer the question on a slip of paper provided. Fold up the slip of paper and turn it in the moderator or team captain. Read the response aloud. Discuss and deliberate on the LEAST favorite response of all the responses. The best answer is awarded 3 pts, second best answer is awarded 2 pts, and the 3rd best will receive 1 pt. After six (6) rounds, you will tally up the points. The one with the most points from each side will be crowned as the Last 2 Standing.

Every player on the board is on the same playing field...physically. Now it's time to stand out mentally, personally, and of course... sexually. Last 2 Standing aims to make your dating relationships easier. Additionally, the last one standing from both sides will be hailed as the most idealistic man and woman for dating! You don't believe me... well GET IN THE GAME!

183939.description:
From the publisher:

The Caproni Ca.3 was an Italian heavy bomber that saw extensive use against the Axis forces. It was used from 1916 until the end of war by Italy, United Kingdom, France and USA. One of the most effective bombers of any air force during WWI, the Ca.3 was a wooden three-engine biplane, armed with twin 6.5 mm or 7.7 mm machine guns and 1,760 lb of bombs.
183939.name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Caproni Ca.3
boardgameexpansion: Wings of Glory: WW1 Duel Pack
Wings of Glory: WW1 Rules and Accessories Pack
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War

183941.name: Bíborhold (Season 3, Issue 12 - Dec 1994)
183941.description:
Bíborhold
Fantasy és Szerepjáték Magazin
1994 December
III Évfolyam 12 Szám

Holdtölte alternatív művészeti

183942.description:
From the publisher:

Just in time for its 600th Anniversary in October of 2015, Tiny Battle Publishing is proud to present "the only Agincourt game you'll ever need", Tom Russell's We Happy Few. Using a modified version of the Shields & Swords medieval battle system, it recreates one of the most famous battles of the Middle Ages.

Near a place called Agincourt, Henry V of England and the exhausted, disease-ridden remnants of his army took on a French force the size of which vastly outnumbered his own, and proceeded to wipe the floor with 'em. The French may have had the numbers, the knights, and the horses, but Hal had a strong defensive position and the all-important English longbow. The French sneered at the bowmen as only Frenchmen can, but like the man said, don't nock it until you've tried it.

Chief among the game's features is a clever, speedy, and diceless alternative to opportunity/reaction fire concepts that reflects the difficulties inherent in moving under missile fire. This results in a very tough game for the French Player. The English Player is favored to recreate the historical result, but it's not a stroll in the park.

Like other titles in the Shields & Swords series, We Happy Few is an ideal introduction to wargaming, but with just enough grit to satisfy the seasoned counter-clipper.
183942.name: We Happy Few: The Battle of Agincourt

183943.description:
Blood Before Richmond is a series of games recreating some of the Seven Days Battles fought between George B. McClellan’s Army of the Potomac and the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia, under its daring new commander, Robert E. Lee. McClellan squandered a numerical advantage by demonstrating what would become a characteristic knack for turning tactical victories into strategic failures. Lee’s ambitious battle plans were hindered by subordinates who seemed incapable of carrying them out - chief among them, oddly, the usually exemplary Stonewall Jackson. If either side had been up to snuff, the war might have been decided in Late June 1862. Tiny Battle Publishing is proud to present this series of quick-playing, medium-complexity games about these fascinating and overlooked battles of the American Civil War, starting with Gaines's Mill.

Our first game in the series focuses on the only Confederate victory of the Seven Days. Despite the atypical outcome, it ticks off all the boxes on your Seven Days Bingo Card (just like the dice, it’s not included). Lee’s ambitious battle plan was abandoned late in the day for piecemeal frontal assaults on well-entrenched Union defensive positions. Jackson twiddled his thumbs for most of the battle, only appearing when Lee met with him personally to coordinate a final all-out assault. This managed to break the Union line, which might have held had the paranoid McClellan not held back vital reinforcements until the last possible moment.

A modified 2d6 die roll determines which Confederate divisions activate on a given turn. Divisions that didn't pull their weight are less likely to show up than those that did most of the fighting. It's a simple, clever, and elegant way to recreate the difficulties that Lee had during the Seven Days, and it creates the frustrating and tantalizing possibility that Jackson could do something if he'd only show up.

Blood Before Richmond builds on the same "stacks of steps" combat system introduced in Tom Russell's Blood on the Alma (2012). Flipping a counter over when you take a hit just doesn't capture the feel of bloody infantry collisions or the horrifying impact of artillery fire. This system uses step counters stacked beneath an identifying counter to account for brutal attrition and devastating wipe-outs.
183943.name: Blood Before Richmond: Gaines's Mill
boardgamefamily: Blood Before Richmond: Battles of the Seven Days

183947.name: Outbreak: Undead (2nd Edition)
183947.description:
Outbreak: Undead
Zombie Survival Role Playing Game
Second Edition Rulebook - Pocket Edition

From the book:

In this game, one player takes the role of the Gamemaster (GM), who runs the elements of the scenario. The remaining players are the Survivors, those who are thrust into the events of the outbreak, trying their best to live day to day.

Outbreak: Undead - Zombie Survival Role Playing Game is a game of Survival Horror.

183948.name: DC Comics Deck-Building Game: Cryptozoic 2015 Volunteer Promo Cards
boardgameexpansion: Attack on Titan: Deck-Building Game
CapCom Street Fighter Deck-Building Game
Cartoon Network Crossover Crisis Deck-Building Game
DC Comics Deck-Building Game
Naruto Shippuden Deck-Building Game
183948.description: A super hero card and three normal cards to add to the game, these cards were printed in extremely limited supply (only 50 copies of each!) and given to the volunteers that helped demo Cryptozoic's games during the 2015 season of conventions. They add new mechanics to the game, namely a randomized effect on use based on the results of a d20 roll.

183949.description:
In the sunny Lanikai Beach is Paula with her family. She's having a vacation there and she seems relaxed but...

Here comes the hawaiian louses! Four tribes are partying too in the head of Paula pulling their hairs like a tug of war game!

She wants to get rid of them but her mom's says: Don't scratch in public, it's a sign of bad behaviour! And Paula is holding it it till she can wait more! Go out louses!

In Paula's Kaulas you have a full tribe of louses for disputing the hairs of Paula. This is a game of bluffing, memory and area control in the head of a tiny person.

Components:
56 Tribe cards (14 for each player)
15 Hairs
15 Scratch events
183949.name: Aloha Pioha

183950.description:
A collection of maps in the new starter kit style. The collection includes maps 1-52 from the ASL modules, and maps t-z from the ASL starter kits 1-3.

These maps are printed on the same material as starter kit maps. They are not paper, nor are they "old-style" mounted boards. Rather they are a lightweight cardstock a little thinner than the thickness of a counter.
boardgameaccessory: For King and Country: ASL module 5a
183950.name: Advanced Squad Leader: ASL Map Bundle

183953.name: Victory at Sea
183953.description:
Evil Twin Artworks’ Victory at Sea game is an epic Real Time Strategy set during World War 2. The game currently boasts more than 100 ship classes and counting, covering 6 nations including USA, Great Britain, Germany, Japan, France and Italy. The game has 3 modes and 3 Theatres of war, covering the Pacific, Atlantic and Mediterranean. There are hundreds of ports, a multitude of island chains, changing weather conditions as well as night and day combat, making this explorative combat game a must buy for any fan of World War 2, RTS or strategy / simulation games.



Victory at Sea is set during world war 2 and has 3 game modes, Historical Battles, Point Battle and Campaign.Bringing an epic approach to real time strategy war gaming, players develop their own story with an open sandbox mechanic in a desperate attempt to win the Second World War.

Navigate fleets around the Atlantic, Pacific and Mediterranean theatres of war and engage in real time epic naval combat. The age of the dreadnoughts has passed and naval warfare has become dominated by aircraft Carriers. Submarines hunt convoys like wolves and the numerous and nimble destroyers rule the oceans.

Game Modes

Historical Battle

Take part in some of the most explosive naval battles during World War 2 such as The Battle of the Denmark Strait, The Battle of Cape Matapan and The last battle of the Bismarck.

Point Battle

Choose to play as either Great Britain, Germany, United States of America, Japan, France and Italy, set a point value and build your fleet. This mode is an excellent feature for the inexperienced Captain wishing to test the strength and weaknesses of specific ships and tactics from WW2.

Campaign

You are awarded the rank of Captain and ordered to hunt the enemy wherever you may find them across the oceans of World War 2. At the beginning of the war you take command of a naval destroyer, through your exploits and missions expand your fleet, receive Medals and go up Ranks as reward for your naval combat.

As a WW2 naval commander you can plan your strategy however you want. Whether you harass trade routes, attack ports or build a fleet of submarines to hit the enemy before disappearing into the night. You will be able to play any combat style. With over 80 authentic classes of warship and counting from WW2, and hundreds of ports set across 3 theatres of war, Victory at Sea offers the player a huge world to explore and defend in this Sandbox Real Time Strategy from Evil Twin Artworks.

Source: The Game Website.

183955.name: Scenes of Chance
183955.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scenes of Chance is a storytelling tool. Whether you need a quick, on-the-fly scene, or simply inspiration for the story you're trying to tell, Scenes of Chance is perfect for you.

Here's how it works:

Each massive, 3.5" x 5.75" card depicts a gorgeous, illustrated scene. On every card are at least three icons, each representing 20 possibilities. If you're adventure is in a forest, try taking all of the forest scenes, shuffle them, and draw one at random. Fate chooses the three elements depicted in the Scene.
Players look at the card, viewing the beautiful scene.




The scene contains three icons.

The DM rolls three 20 sided dice.
Three elements of the scene are revealed to the DM.
The story is created, the DM reveals it for the players.




Scenes of Chance is a collaboration between Twizz Entertainment and Tabletop Props. The result is a unique take on storytelling; 48 cards, over a billion possibilities.

This deck consists of 48 giant cards in a custom tuck box. We are starting small to gage interest in this project but the possibilities for growth and expansion are endless.

183956.name: Scenes of Chance II
183956.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scenes of Chance is a storytelling tool. Whether you need a quick, on-the-fly scene, or simply inspiration for the story you're trying to tell, Scenes of Chance is perfect for you.

Here's how it works:

Each massive, 3.5" x 5.75" card depicts a gorgeous, illustrated scene. On every card are at least three icons, each representing 20 possibilities. If you're adventure is in a forest, try taking all of the forest scenes, shuffle them, and draw one at random. Fate chooses the three elements depicted in the Scene.
Players look at the card, viewing the beautiful scene.




The scene contains three icons.

The DM rolls three 20 sided dice.
Three elements of the scene are revealed to the DM.
The story is created, the DM reveals it for the players.




What's new in SoC2?

We now have a city. In this city there are six locations. Roll a d6 to choose a random location where you will discover a quest. While in this location roll another d6 to find what the main objective of your quest is and what location the quest starts out in.

183957.name: The Castle Triskelion Mega-Dungeon: Outer Ward Third Floor
183957.description:
From the introduction:

Like the lower floors, the majority of the rooms are of
dressed stone, with wooden beams supporting the
ceilings. Floors are made of wood planks, except as noted
elsewhere. Ceiling height is twelve feet, unless otherwise
noted. Many rooms have cressets for torches.

The Third Floor directly connects to the Second Floor
only.

183958.name: Ostfriesen-Pasch
183958.description:
A dice game where each player can roll the dice in a row as long as he can push symbol or number fields upwards. Not operated fields give minus points.

Ostfriesen - reward with Pasch 21 31 or 42. Ostfriesen - risk is to roll three times possibly with doubles 42 minuses. Failing that he gets no minuses but 50 plus points. Failure to achieve the minus points are doubled. Loser is the one who at the agreed end of the game , has the most negative points.

183959.description:
Latice is a strategy game where you match tiles by color and shape. The game comes with a game board, stones, and acrylic tiles. Most of the tiles contain one of six images (e.g., turtle, leaf, lizard, dolphin) in one of six colors. There are also a few special wind tiles. The game is for 2-4 players, who will evenly split the tiles. You win by being the first player to play all of your tiles.

The first player selects one tile from their rack and places it in the center square on the board. The next player, and then each in turn, can add one tile to the board, but that tile must be set adjacent to one or more existing tiles, and it must match each adjacent tile based on either color or shape. If you match more than one tile, or you place your tile on one of the sun squares on the board, you get stones that can be traded in for extra moves, allowing you to get rid of your tiles faster. You can also use the special wind tiles to move a tile already on the board over by one square.

As you play Latice, you’ll learn to plan your turns and extra moves ahead of time. You’ll strategically use wind tiles to alter the layout of the board, and play both offensively and defensively based on your knowledge of the remaining tiles. Latice has no language, culture, age or gender barriers and can be played by just about anyone. It offers strategic gameplay for adults while still being simple enough for younger players.
183959.name: Latice
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 18: The One About New Bedford

183960.description:
The sequel to bestselling Swintus card game makes getting rid of cards even more interesting! Challenge the insidious viruses Necrocough, Deadsnot and Toothrot. Look for a life-saving vaccines — Warmer-burner, Drilly and Proboid. Get ahead of rivals and be the first to reach the victory with your bony hoof!

Game components
64 number cards;
40 cards of "Swine Bureaucracy" regulations;
8 virus cards;
8 vaccine cards;
the rules of the game.

В продолжении карточного бестселлера «Свинтус» избавляться от карт стало ещё интереснее! Бросьте вызов коварным вирусам Некрокашля, Мертвосоплей и Гнилозубья. Ищите спасительные вакцины — Грелку-горелку, Буравушку и Штыроид. Опередите соперников и первым дотянитесь до победы своим костлявым копытом!

Комплектация

64 цифровые карты;
40 карт предписаний «Свинской Бюрократии»;
8 карт вирусов;
8 карт вакцин;
правила игры.
183960.name: Свинтус Зомби

183961.name: Wreck Age: Showdown at Burnt Tierra Gulch
183961.description:
Showdown at Burnt Tierra Gulch is a 2 player starter set that will get you right into the action.

The caravan paths and walking trails through The Wilds take many travelers through Burnt Tierra Gulch. Due to the high rate of traffic, it holds strategic significance to both the Stitchers and the Drifters in the Area.

Playing Showdown at Burnt Tierra Gulch will determine who will control the gulch, and in turn, the resources that flow through it.

This box set includes 5 Drifters and 3 Stitchers and stats for all 8 models, as well as 4 pieces of resin terrain, a scenario pack, quickstart rules, and waypoint tokens.
